Title: Certified Personal Trainer - Carteret
Company: RWJ Rahway Fitness and Wellness Center
Job_Description:
Certified Personal Trainer - Carteret
The Role:
RWJ Rahway Fitness & Wellness at Carteret is a state of the art facility that delivers an exciting and personalized fitness experience to our members. We are looking for Certified Personal Trainers to join our team of fitness experts. As a Certified Personal Trainer, you will be the ultimate provider of fitness, results, and an exceptional member experience. We also provide structure and education to all staff to ensure their success. This includes business development, program design, coaching skills, and more.
Certified Personal Trainers will also:
Promote the mission and values to include exceptional service
Take initiative in enrolling current and potential members into our training program
The primary duties of a Certified Personal Trainer include, but are not limited to
Assist clients in setting specific and attainable fitness goals
Observe clients and inform them of corrective measures necessary for skill and physical improvement
Assist members interested in personal training decisions and finding which training program works best for them
Certified Personal Trainers assist clients in maintaining exertion levels to maximize benefits from exercise routines
Offer alternative exercises and routines to accommodate different levels of fitness
Program Design based on clients’ capabilities, preferences, limitations, and goals
Teach the importance of proper breathing when exercising
Monitor participant’s progress and adapt programs as needed
Provide clients with information and resources regarding weight control and lifestyle change
Advise clients on proper clothing and shoes for exercise
Respond to safety codes and, if needed, administer CPR/AED services to a member
Certified Personal Trainer Qualifications:
All Trainers must be certified. Below are the certifications we accept:
Action (Action – CPT)
Aerobics Fitness Association of America (AFAA)
American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM)
American Council of Exercise (ACE)
International Fitness Professional Association (IFPA)
International Sports Sciences Association (ISSA)
National Academy of Sports Medicine (NASM)
National Council of Strength and Fitness (NCSF)
National Exercise and Sports Trainers Association (NESTA)
National Exercise Trainers Association (NETA)
National Federation of Professional Trainers (NFPT)
National Personal Training Institute (NPTI)
National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA)
Personal Trainer Academy Global (PTA Global)
The Cooper Institute (CI)
National Council for Certified Personal Trainers (NCCPT)
National Athletic Trainers Association (NATA)
World Instructor Training School (W.I.T.S.)
We also accept a Bachelor’s of Science degree in Exercise Science or equivalent field. We also require all of our Certified Personal Trainers to have an active CPR/AED certification through the American Red Cross or similar groups.
Benefits:
Complementary membership as well as discounts on auxiliary services!
401(K)
Benefits for employees who work 30+ hours
Opportunities for growth!'
Work Remotely
No
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $25.00 - $49.00 per hour
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Supplemental pay types:
Commission pay
Experience:
Personal training: 1 year (Preferred)
Work Location: One location

Title: Group Fitness Trainer/Coach
Job_Description:
Legion Transformation Center is a growing fitness brand that is home to the best people, members, and environment. Our mission is to help transform the lives of the communities we serve through health and fitness.
Join an organization that is not only an exciting business with amazing people, but more importantly you get to change the lives of your community. Because Legion Transformation Center is all about exciting and rewarding experiences for our members, we are looking for successful and motivated people who want to improve themselves and their career.
Are you a friendly, passionate, and motivated person who is interested in fitness and can talk to anyone?
Do you have great customer service skills, love people, and are currently, or want to become, a fitness coach?
Then our group fitness coach position in our Exton center is for you!
As a Legion fitness coach, you'll be part of a dynamic team that positively affects the lives of our members on a daily basis. You will be responsible for leading and instructing group training classes, building and maintaining a member base, and wowing our customers with a best in class experience.
Better yet, our part-time position doesn't include split shifts or being at the center for 16 hours each day where your sessions are spread out! You'll be coaching four sessions each day.
Our members range from those who are brand new to fitness to those who have been working out for years but haven’t been attaining their fitness goals. You must have the drive to motivate people and outperform all key performance sales indicators, including challenge sales, membership sales and renewals, retail sales, and member attendance.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Lead and instruct group training sessions
· Create an environment that is fun and filled with energy
· Build strong relationships with challengers/members to be a positive change in their lives
· Motivate and inspire members to get results by setting goals and tracking progress
· Guide and educate members on comprehensive fitness programs and nutrition plans
· Maintain a working knowledge of all products, programs, and services
· Handle member concerns/feedback in a professional manner
· Greet members and guests promptly, enthusiastically, and with a smile, to create and maintain a friendly positive environment
· Plan and execute community outreach to help expand our local brand presence. Collaborate with local businesses to plan events, create partnerships, etc.
· Brainstorm new ideas for location events, member challenges, trial periods, etc. to promote location growth
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
· Previous fitness coaching experience a plus, not a requirement
· Degree in Exercise Science a plus, not a requirement
· Enthusiasm, energy and excellent customer service skills
· Strong verbal and written communication skills
· Ability to function in a fast-paced environment
· Functional computer skills required, such as Google Docs, Sheets, or Microsoft office
· Passion for health and fitness
· Passion for helping people
· High School diploma required
· Flexible to work days, evenings and/or weekend hours as needed
We provide team members with free workouts in our center. On top of everything, strong opportunities for career growth!
Pay: $15.00-18.00 per hour w/ bonus opportunities

Title: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer- Health, Dental Insurance and PTO!
Job_Description:
GROWING COMPANY looking for: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer (No Experience Needed!) with HEALTH BENEFITS, DENTAL INSURANCE and PAID TIME OFF!
MUST BE ABLE TO WORK WEEKDAYS AND SATURDAYS. PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS JOB POSTING IF YOU CANNOT WORK SATURDAYS. THANK YOU!
Ever wondered what it would be like to do a job that you truly love! The ability to change people’s lives daily. Our team here at Time Saver Fitness could not be more delighted to announce that we are actively hiring for an Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer!
POSITION: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer
What makes us unique? We specialize in just two, twenty-minute workouts per week with each one of our clients! While many positions require a certification and experience in the field, we can with full certainly say, NO experience is needed. In fact, we have our own full certification here at Time Saver Fitness where you will become an expert in the field of physical fitness learning and gaining extensive knowledge and skills based on human anatomy and body mechanics giving you the ability to help any client achieve the results they truly desire. In fact, while most have to pay for a full certification, we will PAY YOU! Yup, we will pay you to go through Time Saver Fitness’ full certification. Once hired, a trainee will go through our extensive certification lasting roughly a month and a half to two months.
The type of person we’re looking for? Surprisingly enough, someone that has NO experience in the fitness industry is someone we prefer. Due to our full certification, we will teach you everything you need to know. If you are dedicated to helping others through past experiences, have a vibrant, outgoing, and kind personality then there is a strong change we want to hear from you. Lastly, if you TRULY TRULY, enjoy helping others out and fit the qualities outlined, there is a chance you might be the PERFECT fit for our team.
PERSONALITY CHARACTERISTICS: We are looking for an amazing person with the personality to go along with it! Are you ENERGETIC, UPBEAT, HIGH LEVEL OF INTEGRITY, MOTIVATED, LOOK AT THE GLASS HALF FULL, A PASSION FOR LIFE and want to change the way someone lives?
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Coach clients through each of their 20-minute, One-on-One personal training sessions paying attention to form, control, body mechanics, breathing and level of determination
· Coach clients through each of their 20-minute workouts to help them achieve the goals and results they are looking for
· Despite client’s limitations or injuries, always give positive reinforcement
· Give basic nutrition advice to clients should they inquire about it
· During each shift, ALWAYS abide by Time Saver Fitness’ 6 Core Company Values
· Go above and beyond for your team and clients
· Have fun and do what you love! You’re changing client’s lives forever!
PART TIME: We are currently looking to fill a part time position with the potential of full time in the future. Yes! If desired, we would love to make you full time as we continue to grow and expand. SATURDAYS AN ADDITIONAL MUST!
EXPANSION: Time Saver Fitness has helped so many clients that not only are we hiring but we are growing too! Our second location in Lakewood Ranch is now open with more locations to come.
UPWARD MOBILITY: If you have the desire for training clients and management too, be rest assured there is opportunity for facility management and upward mobility in the future THROUGHOUT one of our locations.
EXPERIENCE: No experience is needed! Due to our extensive two-month certification, we will certify you! In fact, well even PAY YOU to go through certification!
EDUCATION: A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred but certainly not required or needed.
PAY AND COMPENSATION: We believe that pay is really important too! Our pay scale we feel is extremely generous at $17-$18 per hour!
HEALTH BENEFITS: We’re truly really excited to mention that we offer Health Benefits to all employees! YES…you read it correct. With healthcare so important in this day an age, we’re REALLY HAPPY to be able to offer such a rare benefit within the fitness industry.
DENTAL BENEFITS: We are super excited to offer Dental Insurance to all staff should they decide to opt into it.
PAID TIME OFF (PTO): Within the fitness industry, PTO is something that is rare or never heard of. Here at Time Saver Fitness, we feel that PTO is important for all staff, thus all staff are given it each year.
LOCATION: The facility we are currently hiring for is in the heart of Sarasota Downtown and Lakewood Ranch.
WHEN ARE WE LOOKING TO HIRE: Immediately should someone be the right fit for our team!
HOW TO APPLY: Submit your most current resume to email address in this posting. Once submitted, you will be invited to Time Saver Fitness’ Hiring Seminar. The Hiring Seminar will include an overview of Time Saver Fitness, job description and 1-1 BRIEF interview.
We would love to have you join our AMAZING team! Please call or email so that we can begin the application process!

Title: Exercise Specialist/Athletic Trainer/Exercise Physiologist
Company: Crystal Coast Wellness and Performance Center
Job_Description:
Job Description
We are seeking an enthusiastic, skilled, and motivated Exercise Specialist/Personal Trainer to join our growing health and wellness team. You will work with a variety of individuals seeking to improve their health and wellness with a focus on the unique needs of the person. When necessary, you will collaborate with other professionals, including but not limited to registered dietitians and physical therapists, to provide a comprehensive approach to full body wellness. All of our Exercise Specialists/Personal Trainers must have a positive and encouraging attitude to motivate and empower clients to reach their goals.
General Duties
Develop customized individual, small group (0-5 individuals), and large group (6-10+ individuals) training programs.
Properly execute 30-60-minute workouts for one-on-one training personal training clients, semi-private group training settings (0-5 individuals), and large group settings (6-10+ individuals).
Identify client goals through a structured consultation process and determine the appropriate method of training that will enable the client to reach those goals, whether this be through one-on-one personal training, small group training (0-5 individuals), and/or large group training (6-10+ individuals).
Perform initial consultations, pre-exercise screenings, and movement assessments to aid in the determination of appropriate training methods and the creation of individualized training programs.
Be able to identify the need for, provide, and demonstrate both regressions and progressions for each exercise in the training program as appropriate for the individual.
Provide individual supervision and instruction during client training sessions.
Monitor effectiveness of training programs through performance of regular reassessments.
Demonstrate exercises and explain safety considerations for each exercise.
Properly execute, demonstrate, and explain all exercises included in training programs.
Identify and explain the safety considerations of each exercise.
Instruct clients in the proper and preferred use of all strength training equipment.
Instruct clients in strength training principles, training procedures, and exercise techniques.
Proficiency in company utilized software for scheduling, delivering services, and completing staff duties.
Documentation of all personal training sessions using company policies and procedures.
Conduct facility tours.
Educational Requirements
Exercise Specialist/Personal Trainer must have a bachelor's degree in kinesiology, exercise science or physical education. Courses in basic nutrition, exercise techniques and group fitness are beneficial. CPR certification recommended but not required.
Certification(s)
Personal trainer certification from a NCCA Accredited organization (NSCA, ACSM, ACE, NASM) strongly recommended but not required.
ACSM Certified Exercise Physiologist and/or NSCA CSCS highly recommended but not required.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Expond is seeking dedicated health professionals for a part-time contract role in the Santa Barbara region.
Expond is an on-demand service that provides yoga, Pilates, fitness, wellness, and outdoor adventure experiences to patrons of luxury hotels, clubs, and private residences. We are actively seeking Personal trainers and professionals who are enthusiastic about promoting health and wellness while helping clients achieve their fitness goals.
The ideal candidate must be flexible and adaptable to the needs of each client and capable of thriving in varying work environments. Excellent communication and hospitality skills, along with excellent time management skills, are also necessary. Knowledge of basic nutrition, anatomy, functional exercise, and basic exercise science is required, as well as certification in personal training from reputable institutions such as NASM, NSCA, ACSM, ACE, or ISSA. CPR/AED certification is required, and basic computer and phone skills are necessary. Hiking guides do not require certification.
At Expond, we offer competitive compensation, including generous tips, and flexible schedules with work opportunities available seven days a week. We are committed to providing a supportive environment that promotes self-development and continuing education.
We provide recurring clients and handle the marketing and administrative tasks that come with running a business. Our goal is to allow you to focus on what you do best while leaving the rest to us!

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Expond is seeking dedicated health professionals for a part-time contract role in the Santa Barbara region.
Expond is an on-demand service that provides yoga, Pilates, fitness, wellness, and outdoor adventure experiences to patrons of luxury hotels, clubs, and private residences. We are actively seeking Personal trainers and professionals who are enthusiastic about promoting health and wellness while helping clients achieve their fitness goals.
The ideal candidate must be flexible and adaptable to the needs of each client and capable of thriving in varying work environments. Excellent communication and hospitality skills, along with excellent time management skills, are also necessary. Knowledge of basic nutrition, anatomy, functional exercise, and basic exercise science is required, as well as certification in personal training from reputable institutions such as NASM, NSCA, ACSM, ACE, or ISSA. CPR/AED certification is required, and basic computer and phone skills are necessary. Hiking guides do not require certification.
At Expond, we offer competitive compensation, including generous tips, and flexible schedules with work opportunities available seven days a week. We are committed to providing a supportive environment that promotes self-development and continuing education.
We provide recurring clients and handle the marketing and administrative tasks that come with running a business. Our goal is to allow you to focus on what you do best while leaving the rest to us!

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM

At VASA Fitness, we want to create an uplifting experience for everyone by offering inclusive, accessible, and on-trend fitness. The foundation of our brand is rooted in a culture centered on unity, passion, love, integrity, fun, and trust. Because our culture is alive—embodied by members and team members alike—VASA is a place where lives are changed because of authentic connections made within our supportive community.
We offer a competitive, all-encompassing benefits package which includes healthcare benefits for employees who work 20+ hours per week. All employees receive two complimentary gym memberships—one for themselves and another to give away—plus 401k options.
30+ hours per week employees: Paid Time Off (hourly), Health, Dental, Vision Benefits and Paid Parental Leave (in addition to above)
40 hours per week employees: Flexible Vacation Plan (salary) & Paid Holidays (in addition to above)

Come join VASA Fitness and join a passionate, fun, and united team!
VASA is hiring Personal Trainers! All experience levels welcome!

Less than 1-year of personal training or coaching experience? No problem! We would love to teach the way VASA Personal Training Coaches help our members get healthy, feel strong and be happy!

Experienced personal trainer or coach? We can’t wait for you to connect with our members!

JOB TYPE: Full-time & Part-time available

Job Description
POSITION TITLE: Personal Trainer
REPORTS TO: Fitness Team Lead
FLSA Status: Hourly

COMPENSATION
Base pay is $12.00 per hour. Average pay is $18.00 per hour!
Client Training Session Range: $22.00-$33.00 per hour!
Semi-private Training Session Range $44.00-$66.00 per hour!

PURPOSE
The personal trainer is a trusted team member who guides clients to success on their health and fitness journey. They do this through providing a world class training experience through our UPLIFT values and a caring and connected approach in every session. The Personal Trainer will prioritize, plan, and execute tactics to acquire new and retain existing clients.

DELIVERABLES
The Personal Trainer will meet on a regular basis with the FTL to plan, prioritize and execute tactics to ensure success on the deliverables, which include but are not limited to, the following:
Acquisition of new and retention of existing clientele. The Personal Trainer is responsible for performing all activities relative to the acquisition and retention of personal training clients.
Schedule and deliver complimentary PT sessions. Personal Trainers schedule then deliver personal training sessions for existing VASA members and execute on all processes and procedures for the success of each client.
Personal Trainers are agile in their training approach. This includes facilitating & adjusting exercise programming to fit the exact needs of each client. The Personal Trainer will demonstrate care & create connection throughout the duration of the client journey.
Create an approachable environment in and around the Personal Training Cage. This includes interacting with members, clients & guests in a friendly, fun, energetic & inclusive way. Personal Trainers will also demonstrate consistency in appearance, safety protocols, and cleaning activities.
Create a supportive, connected community for all clients. This includes utilizing the VASA programs, tools & resources, to deliver meaningful personal trainer check-ins, coaching and encouragement in the on-going success of each client.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
The competencies for successful performance in this role include, but are not limited to, the following:
CPR/AED Certification (must obtain within the first 30 days of employment).
Open minded with an ability to learn new approaches and can think outside the box.
Optimistic mindset with a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude.
Passionate about fitness and helping people live a healthy lifestyle
Great problem solving skills
Excellent communication skills

PREFERRED (NOT REQUIRED) QUALIFICATIONS
Previous personal training experience a plus.
Additional certifications relative to Personal Training.
NCAA-accredited Personal Training Certification or industry related degree.

This position description intends to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to include all duties and responsibilities. The order in which duties and responsibilities are listed is not significant.
VASA Fitness is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job_Description:
APS Management is launching a new corporate wellness program and we already have lined up one of the most elite private equity firms in New York as a client. We are only going to grow from here.
We are seeking phenomenal personal trainers with certifications and a proven track record of experience to join us to take care of our hard-working finance clients.
You'll work as a contractor with us. We'll handle contracts, payment, scheduling, and customer service. You show up on time to the client's home or apartment (these are all high-net-worth individuals living in Manhattan) and do what you do - transform lives through your gift of personalized fitness instruction.
We're happy to pay you $100 per session, minimum - possibly more depending on your experience. Our main goal right now is to build our brand and show results.
You will not receive any reimbursement for travel. The $100 we pay you per session includes compensation for traveling to their location in Manhattan and providing a 45 minute to 60 minute session.
Equipment is on site. You just need to show up.
Please reply if you can help us taking care of these clients. We would be honored to work with you.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
At MAC GYM we run things as should supposed to be.
You focus on what you love, coaching and training, and leave the sales and chasing new clients to us.
Here is What We Are Looking For:
First and foremost we are looking for a people person. We are known for our programs and coaching but in reality, we are in the customer service business and we work with people. One of the biggest reasons for our success is because we realize that our members are everything to our business and we do everything we can to get to know them and find out how can we motivate them and help them reach their goals.
Second, our trainers needs to be a life-long learner. One of our core values is "always learn-constantly improve". We're constantly learning something new and working on becoming better at what we do. We even give incentives to our coaches for continuing education.
Third, we're looking for a team player.
And last but not least we're looking for an enthusiastic, motivated, hard-working, and HIGH ENERGY PERSON (this is really important) to start working and coaching our clients as soonest possible.
About the Position
We currently offer mostly one-on-one one sessions and nutrition programs that motivate, educate, and support men and women to improve their health, fitness, and performance. Most of our programs include nutrition coaching, fitness testing, and body composition analysis.
If you are accepted for this position, you'll undergo a 2-4 week internship and training to learn our system. The majority of your training clients' hours vary. There will be some additional hours between for fitness assessments, coaching and consultations with clients, follow-ups with clients, training on our system, meetings.
Bottom line: After your initial training is over and you're ready to start. Mac Gym facility's offer a casual, fun environment, state-of-the-art training equipment, and the opportunity to learn the inner workings of a successful fitness business.
Oh yea, we’re also very fair, respectful, and appreciative. We like having fun and making money by providing highly valuable fitness services and products.
You will be compensated fairly, treated fairly and we will certainly look for ways to pay you more for your efforts if they warrant it. I want someone who enjoys working with people and making a difference in the lives of others - because that's what we do in our business.
Our current facility is located 40 N. Groesbeck Hwy., Mount Clemens, MI. 48043 and 31059 Harper Ave., St. Clair Shores, MI. 48082
Tasks We Need You to Perform
Deliver Comprehensive Health & Fitness Programs For Clients: You'll receive coaching and training on our fitness system and programs, but you'll be expected to deliver them in a fun, high energy, enthusiastic, educational, and supportive manner.
Tracking Client Progress: In order to ensure a client's success in our programs, you'll need to track clients' progress, current successes, and challenges, review client nutrition logs, and more, on a weekly basis. It will be your job to hold our clients accountable to his/her health and fitness program to ensure the best results possible.
Perform Fitness Evaluations: You'll need to perform a fitness assessment and test for: body composition, body weight, girth measurements, and various strength and flexibility tests. You do not need previous experience, but if you do, that's a bonus.
Demonstrate Proper Exercise Instruction: This is a big one. I need you to be able to provide proper coaching, instruction, and motivation during a client training session. You should have a working knowledge of the human body (i.e. muscles, movements, functions, etc.) and be able to provide appropriate exercises for the client's goals.
Provide Ongoing Health and Fitness Education: Our clients rely on us to service all of their health and fitness needs. It is your job as a fitness coach to provide our clients with health and fitness education on various topics that will empower them to lead healthy lives forever.
Required Skills
These are the skills you must already have in order to qualify for this position:
No Certification we will intern YOU- Some previous personal training or group training experience and understanding of human anatomy, physiology and biomechanics is beneficial but not required.
Basic nutrition knowledge: You've heard this one: "You can't out-train a bad diet". We believe in this and that is why most of our programs include the nutritional component included in the membership. Our next coach should understand the basic nutritional principles and be able to advise clients on proper nutrition.
Good Communication Skills: You will be talking with my clients, who are VERY important to me. You must be comfortable conversing in person and on the phone and know how to conduct yourself professionally, and deliver clear instructions to the clients. We'll teach you everything you need to do during a training session, but I can't teach you manners and professionalism.
People Skills and Personality: You must LOVE working with people! As mentioned above you must be very comfortable working with people. These are exciting training facilities and you must be able to show our clients energy and excitement while working with them.
CPR Certified: If you don't have one it’s not a problem you can easily get one in a day.
How to Apply
We're looking to hire the right (5) people as soon as possible. So if this job sounds good to you, then apply immediately.
Here is what we want from you:
Punctual and prepared for all appointments with clients or staff meetings
Passionate about fitness and coaching others with purpose while providing excellent customer service
Ability to motivate others to improve their overall fitness and health
Desire to help clients reach their health and fitness goals through proper cardiovascular, flexibility and resistance exercise
Knowledge of anatomy, functional exercise, basic nutrition, and basic exercise science
Conducts Fitness Assessments according to Company protocol
Educates members on current health and fitness issues and trends
Exceptionally member service oriented and possesses outstanding communication skills
Ability to design exercise programs tailored to the needs of specific clients/goals
Ability to demonstrate and teach exercises while providing feedback on technique
Ability to execute individual fitness program design in a safe and effective manner
Understands the importance of maintaining accurate and current client files
Dedicated to maintaining personal integrity and personal health and fitness
Willingness to uphold Company protocol and policies
Attends mandatory and optional staff training classes
Promotes and sells personal training programs and services
Remains current on certifications and new trends in the industry

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Current Employees:
If you are a current Staff, Faculty or Temporary employee at the University of Miami, please click here to log in to Workday to use the internal application process. To learn how to apply for a faculty or staff position using the Career worklet, please review this tip sheet .
The department of Med. Wellness and Recreation has an exciting opportunity for a Part Time/TEMP - Personal Trainer to work at the UHealth Campus. The role of the Personal Trainer will be to create, implement, and supervise safe, personalized workouts for Wellness Center members seeking personal training services.
Design safe and effective 30 minute to 1-hour fitness programming for individual clients, adapting the training program to each person’s specific needs and abilities.
Instruct clients in safe training principles and exercise techniques.
Teach clients the proper and preferred use of fitness equipment.
Inform clients of new information regarding exercise safety and effectiveness.
Provide individual supervision and reinforcement during client training sessions.
Promote Personal Training through personal example and member interaction.
Provide online consultations and virtual training services as needed.
Help maintain a neat, clean and pleasant environment on the fitness floor.
Attend scheduled Personal Trainer staff meetings and participate in appropriate workshops.
Stay current on fitness concepts and ideas. Attend continuing education courses and mandatory trainings.
This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities as necessary.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
High School diploma or equivalent required, Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field preferred.
Certification in relevant specialty or field required; CPR/First Aid certified within 30 days of hire.
Minimum 1 year of relevant experience.
Knowledge, Skills and Attitudes:
Skill in completing assignments accurately and with attention to detail.
Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work under pressure while meeting deadlines.
Ability to process and handle confidential information with discretion.
Ability to work evenings, nights, and weekends as necessary.
Commitment to the University’s core values.
Ability to work independently and/or in a collaborative environment.
Certification from an accredited professional wellness coach-training program preferred.
Knowledge of specific disease and lifestyle related topics such as weight management, nutrition, pre/post-natal care, stress reduction and chronic conditions.
Ability to work with adults and seniors from beginner to advanced levels of fitness experience.
Must have the physical, visual and auditory ability to perform the essential functions of the job.
Must be able to lift at least 45 pounds.
Wellness Coach/Personal Trainer must abide by policies, procedures and guidelines.
The University of Miami offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, tuition remission and more.
UHealth-University of Miami Health System, South Florida's only university-based health system, provides leading-edge patient care powered by the ground breaking research and medical education at the Miller School of Medicine. As an academic medical center, we are proud to serve South Florida, Latin America and the Caribbean. Our physicians represent more than 100 specialties and sub-specialties, and have more than one million patient encounters each year. Our tradition of excellence has earned worldwide recognition for outstanding teaching, research and patient care. We're the challenge you've been looking for.
Patient safety is a top priority. As a result, during the Influenza ("the flu") season (September through April), the University Of Miami Miller School Of Medicine requires all employees who provide ongoing services to patients, work in a location (all Hospitals and clinics) where patient care is provided, or work in patient care or clinical care areas, to have an annual influenza vaccination. Failure to meet this requirement will result in rescinding or termination of employment.
The University of Miami is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities are encouraged to apply. Applicants and employees are protected from discrimination based on certain categories protected by Federal law. Click here for additional information.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Position Description:
Are you a fitness professional who is passionate about helping clients AND wants to earn what you deserve and be in charge of your own schedule?
Yes? Then TruFit Personal Training Studios, LLC is looking for personal trainers and coaches like you!
If you are an experienced, certified fitness pro looking for an amazing space to run your business, then please submit your resume and a brief (no more than a minute or two) video explaining why you’re looking for a new training gig. Videos can be sent to izzy@trufitpersonaltraining.com. But PLEASE keep reading :)
TruFit trainers and coaches get to:
● Train their own clients independently while still working in a fun, inclusive environment with a strong community
● Determine their own salaries
● Build their own businesses without the risk of leasing or owning their own building
● Take advantage of on-site business coaching to hasten the pace of building a profitable workload
About TruFit:
TruFit is a one-of-a-kind co-working space for fitness and wellness pros to thrive in a community while being their own boss, charging their own rates, choosing their own schedule. You get to be your own boss without having to own your own gym!
TruFit provides trainers with:
● Client leads through its internal referral network and marketing plan
● A fully-equipped space -- over 3000 square feet -- with equipment ranging from kettlebells to pullup bars, squat racks to a sled, dual cable machine to medicine balls
● Multiple rooms to train out of
● Business coaching by the TruFit owner who loves to assist pros with the business side of personal training as needed
TruFit currently has two physical therapists and and also hosts a number of events featuring nutrition classes, community acupuncture, and training workshops to live up to our vision of being truly client-centered.
Unlike many stereotypes of a gym, TruFit’s culture is one of openness, inclusivity, providing fitness for all bodies without intimidation or fear tactics. TruFit is like your friendly neighborhood pub but… a gym! So we want to make sure the space is a good fit for the candidate AND for TruFit.
Applicant Requirements:
● Strong communication and relationship-building skills
● Flexible schedule that includes early morning (5:30/6:00AM availability) and/or evening hours (5:30PM or later); weekend availability is a plus, too
● Ability and desire to train 20 hours/week
● Reliable transportation
● Ability to work independently
● Certification in personal training
● CPR/AED required
● 2+ years of personal training experience
If you are an experienced, certified fitness pro looking for an amazing space to run your business, then please submit your resume and a brief (no more than a minute or two) video explaining why you’re looking for a new training gig. Videos can be sent to izzy@trufitpersonaltraining.com.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Job Description
StretchLab Encino is seeking Personal Trainers, Athletic Trainers, Massage Therapist, Yoga Instructors, Dancers, Physical Therapist Aides, and Corrective Exercise Specialists to join our team. This is an amazing opportunity to gain experience in a new modality that is taking the health and wellness industry to a new level.
Our Flexologist provide one-on-one assisted stretches for our clients. We are the industry leaders in one-on-one assisted stretching and have created a variety of offerings to empower clients to "Live Long". StretchLab prides itself on having the finest team of stretching professionals, and our proprietary Flexologist Training Program (FTP) is recognized by various accredited Fitness Associations ensuring that our clients receive a world class stretching experience. Our clientele ranges through all demographics such as athletes, youth athletes, entrepreneurs, retired persons, high profile celebs and more.
The goal of a Flexologist is to create the best professional stretching experience for our clients by ensuring that they get the most out of their stretch without every putting them in danger of pain or injury. Our Flexologist guide every client through each stretch, making sure the client knows what the stretch is designed to do and how it should feel. The Flexologist will let the client know where they are significantly tight and what the client can do during their daily routine to help them improve their mobility and quality of life. Our Flexologist work part-time in a very flexible and enjoyable environment.
Perks
· Compensation: Starting pay of $25/hour for every 50-min stretch performed (hourly+commission)
· Access to cutting edge recovery tools and techniques
· Motivating and upbeat environment
· Paid training & Continuing Education
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
· Deliver one-on-one assisted stretch sessions
· Educate clients on stretching techniques and mobility
· Create customized stretching experience for clients
· Help create a unique StretchLab experience helping build memberships and retention
· Ensure safety of clients in regards to proper stretching techniques and enforce StretchLab Policies and safety regulations
· Attend staff meetings, training sessions, and complete continuing education
· Help clean and maintain the studio environment and equipment in order to ensure it is available for client use at any given time
Qualifications
Certification and/or degree from a nationally accredited organization in one or more of the following fields:
· Personal Trainer, Athletic Trainer, or Sports Performance Coach
· Massage Therapist
· Physical Therapist or Physical Therapist Aide
· Yoga Instructor
· Pilates Instructor
· Kinesiology, Sports Medicine, Corrective Exercise, etc.
Required Characteristics
· Must have a professional work ethics, be reliable and adhere to our strict punctuality policies
· Positive energy, enthusiasm and attitude
· Ability to create a welcoming environment for all people
· Fantastic communication skills and exudes empathy and compassion
· Must love connecting with people and have passion for helping others achieve goals
· MUST be team oriented ("we, not me")
Availability
Shifts are generally 6 hours each and must be open to working some weekends
About Us
StretchLab Encino is coming soon – early 2023. We are building an awesome team and are looking for unique individuals looking to be a part of something special. We do what we can to provide a life changing experience for all that come through our doors. We are looking for individuals who can contribute to our top tier service by contributing with strong work ethics and a passion to help others. Daily focus, punctuality, customer service and a commitment to excellence are paramount.
We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
ABOUT ACTIVE
Active Wellness is the leadingFitness Services Management Companypassionate about building active communities through fitness and wellness. With 60 sites across the country, our mission is to build and inspire healthier, more active lives through high-touch interactions and technologies that support a better quality of life. We accomplish this by creating inspiring environments, delivering results-based programming, and building meaningful relationships that support positive change in people's lives.
Our team is energetic, active, and fun. We listen to our team, doing what's best for our people while focusing on delivering the best products and programming in the industry. Our employees have continued support, training, and resources to deliver results to our members, and clients.
If you love making a difference in people's lives, we would love to connect. We're dedicated to helping people live the best lives possible, and we're always looking for individuals that are passionate like us to join Team Active.
WHY ACTIVE?
> Full Medical, Dental, Vision Health Benefits
> 401k investment options
> Internship Program
> Competitive Base Salary
> Employee Referral Bonus Program
> Network of 1200+ fitness industry professionals
> Team Active Trainings including Quarterly Safety Programs, Member Experience Training, etc.
> Complimentary Employee Well-Being Programs
> Exclusive discounts and memberships on fitness industry associations and training
> Complimentary Club Membership and discounts on all Active products and more!
ACCOMPLISHMENTS
#1 Health Club, #1 Vendor, Best Innovation, Best Medical Fitness, Top 100 Health Clubs in US, Best and Brightest in Wellness, Distinguished Service Award
CERTIFIED PERSONAL TRAINER
Pay Transparency: $38 - $48 hourly (DOE)
Role and Responsibilities
The Certified Personal Trainer is responsible for managing the fitness floor, being responsive to members and guests by offering assistance, and educating Active Wellness members on the safe and correct use of cardio and weight training equipment. This person also performs assessments, provides package prescriptions, answers fitness, and wellness-related questions, and sells personal training packages.
Specific Responsibilities
Essential Functions
Sell and deliver personal training sessions to clients
Schedule and conduct new member onboarding sessions
Assist with new member outreach and follow-up with low users
Assist members in using safe and effective exercise forms during their workouts
Maintain a clean, safe and orderly fitness floor, racking weights. Includes picking up loose towels, water bottles, magazines, cleaning equipment, etc.
Perform fitness assessments (movement and posture assessments, blood pressure checks, body composition tests) as requested by members
Support, teach, and encourage members to meet his/her fitness goals
Assist in the development and implementation of new fitness programs/classes
Administer emergency care to members and guests in need of assistance
Work as a TEAM with all other departments
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the supervisor
Other Functions
Be knowledgeable about all programs and activities offered by Active Wellness
Promote club services and activities
Assist with keeping the club well stocked and clean
Attend Active Wellness site meetings and training
Handle injury and illness and security incident reporting
Requirements:
Qualifications and Education Requirements
Communication skills, customer service oriented
Operational knowledge of resistance training equipment and proper form
Knowledge of anatomy, biomechanics
Knowledge of injury prevention and basic rehabilitation
Knowledge of basic movement and posture assessments and body composition assessments
Ability to calculate target heart rate
Basic knowledge of nutrition
Four (4) years of college degree in fitness related field or a certificate from an accredited 2-year program at a university preferred
Minimum one (1) NCCA or NBFE accredited certification
Previous health club personal training experience is a plus.
Must be detail-oriented, organized, and highly responsive with a commitment to customer service
Strong verbal communication skills
Basic computer skills, customer service skills, results-oriented, ability to multitask, and commitment to the fitness industry
AED/CPR/First Aid Certified
National Personal Training Certification(s) required (see approved Certification, Licenses, and Permits list) as well as modality-specific certifications as required by role (if applicable)
Proof of citizenship or legal status
Physical and Working Conditions
Ability to take the responsibility for the health and safety of others
Ability to stand for several hours in the same shift; ability to lift 25 lbs
Fitness club environment
Must follow OSHA and Active Wellness safety standards
This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.
Active Wellness LLC is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our locations or our website athttps://www.activewellness.com/careers.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
We aren't your average gym and you're probably ready to stop working long hours and having your entire day pass you by. At FiT PRiNT you are guaranteed hours in a fun environment that nerds out to fitness - but we can't promise to be normal. ;-)
We embrace individuality and let each person's freak flag fly high! The founders at FiT PRiNT strive to create a career for each of their coaches (also known as senseis) and cultivate the opportunity to do what they love without having to worry about finding clients and selling.
But more into being a Fitness Coach (aka Sensei) at FiT PRiNT. You'll be one of our exercise and wellness coaches responsible for helping clients (also known as Ninjas) achieve their goals of physical fitness. If interested in the position please forward your resume plus one reason you would make a good fit for the Ninja clan.
Core Responsibilities
Ability to train, motivate and hold clients accountable to high standards of performance.
Present yourself in a professional and energetic manner by meeting or exceeding a Ninja's energy within a session.
Highly collaborative, empathetic, and exude patience with a positive attitude.
Specific Duties And Responsibilities
Complete and update Ninja's personalized exercise programs.
Set fitness goals with Ninjas during scheduled times (snuggle sessions).
Coach in PT 2.0 setting (1 coach: 3 clients) & Group Classes (1 coach: 16 clients).
Track each Ninja's progress within a training session.
Charge ninjas for retail purchases through member applications.
Communicate efficiently and effectively with Ninjas on expectations and performance.
Education, Experience, And Skills
Certification in personal training or strength and conditioning coach through ACSM, NSCA, NASM, ACE, or another nationally recognized organization.
Certification in CPR/AED/First Aid (current or obtained before hire).
Minimum of one-year experience training.
Must be able to communicate effectively verbally and in writing with clients and coworkers.
Ability to manage time effectively within a training session and administrative hours.

Title: Personal Trainer : Part time In Person/Remote
Job_Description:
JOB SUMMARY
You demonstrate the desired skills, behaviors, and mindset to create and deliver effective programs and experiences both in person and virtually. You must be able to work in a collaborative, fast-moving, and ambiguous environment while managing time effectively and be willing to lead tasks and projects to completion. Skills, behaviors, and mindset include but are not limited to:
Skills:
You efficiently design experiences with the users in mind
You articulately deliver and display effective communication skills
Behaviors:
You influence others to achieve results
You develop an inclusive environment both in person and virtually
Mindset:
You are motivated by being part of a team
You are adaptable and able to adjust to ever changing environments
JOB DESCRIPTION
Primary Responsibilities:
Program Design - Using BOOM's methodology and philosophy, you successfully design customized programs for users of varying abilities and goals with an emphasis on quality movement, careful instruction, and safe results.
Team Approach- You work well in a team setting and put the BOOM philosophy, a client centric focus at the forefront.
Deliver Instruction- You skillfully lead users through sessions both virtually and in person, while demonstrating proper movement quality to ensure maximum levels of success for all participants.
Administer Assessments- Routinely schedule and perform BOOM consultations and assessments for users in order to better understand their abilities, goals, and limitations.
Represent the BOOM Brand- Proudly represent the team both virtually and in person during meetings, video, and special events. You clearly articulate the scope of service delivery to users in a creative and thoughtful manner.
Developing Skill Sets- Vigorously seek out opportunities to learn and grow. Welcome feedback and dialogue around your own performance and work to build off of your strengths.
Solve Problems- Utilize creative solutions to provide the highest level of customer service and ensure no barrier stands in the way of users and their goals.
Marketing and Sales- comfortable selling and marketing yourself and the BOOM program to prospective companies and clients.
Share Insight- Effectively communicate to all. You are willing to share thoughts, concerns, and opportunities to those around you and work toward an identified common goal.
Preferred Qualifications:
· Completed Bachelor's Degree or higher
· Nationally recognized certification, preferably NSCA-CSCS, NASM or ACSM
· Minimum 2 year’s internship/work experience in fitness industry and overall interest and lifestyle surrounding wellness
· Open to evolving technologies and display excellent computer and technological skills
· Ample understanding and efficiency with Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Zoom
· Effective interpersonal communication skills, both written and verbal
· High energy, with ability to use your voice to motivate and inspire users of all fitness levels
· Ability to create and deliver an instructional experience both in person and digitally
Pay: Competitive– years of experience will dictate
Hours: 10-15 hours/week to start
Start Date: March 2023
Location: West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and LA area

Social: @boomteamusa

Title: Group Fitness Instructor and Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
We at BPLA, The Blueprint Los Angeles, aren’t worried about who is the strongest or the fastest. We are about working hard together and leaving all egos at the front door. We have people come through these doors at all different fitness levels. Professional athletes, mothers, fathers, young, and old. All are here to reach a common goal, to live our best and healthiest life.
We are adamant about coaching our clients before they hit the training floor. The real coaching starts when we have our Goal Setting Strategy Session. This is where we sit down with our members and dig deep to find out what they are really looking for and what goals drove them through our door. We support each other, we fight for each other and most of all we celebrate each other's success! At BPLA we are One Tribe and all are working towards a common goal.
BPLA creates a customized training program for our members. We focus on eating right, training hard, and maximizing our fun.
We are not a gym full of gimmicks and quick fixes like you’ll find elsewhere. There is no protein shake, 21 day fat burning quick fix here. Instead we focus on creating a roadmap to sustainable success, for a lifetime of health and happiness.
BPLA is looking to bring on two experienced and passionate trainers.
All inquiries should be sent to Info@TheBlueprintLA.com.
Resume and cover letter are required.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Are you ready for an amazingly different fitness career experience? It’s time to BUST OUT of the gym! GYMGUYZ is #1 in Home Personal Training nationwide. We are seeking to grow the team of one of our premiere franchises in your area. JOB SUMMARYThe Certified Personal Trainer will be responsible for providing one-on-one and small group personalized fitness instruction to clients while encouraging them to reach their fitness goals. A GYMGUYZ Trainer will provide professional instruction for each client's health, fitness and wellness goals while providing the highest level of customer service. A GYMGUYZ Trainer must adapt to various working type environments including private homes, offices, or an appropriate setting of the client’s choice. The distance of travel to your clients may vary but is generally within 30 minutes. Drive time of more than 30 minutes and mileage may be reimbursed at the discretion of your manager. BENEFITS/PERKS
No sales quotas or floor shifts
No cold calling or having to find clients
Flexible schedule
Competitive compensation rates
Bonus opportunities/incentives
Free & discounted recertification education
Opportunity for career growth
Great team to work with!
RESPONSIBILITIES
Customize client workout programs developed from the initial assessment
Utilize the GYMGUYZ Fitness App for all client sessions, including programming & session notes
Demonstrate each exercise and ensure client is performing correctly with or without modifications
Conduct client reassessments every 4 – 6 weeks
Maintain client session appointments through GYMGUYZ scheduling software
Able to collect and secure payments from clients, as needed
Able to provide a flexible schedule to accommodate client appointments
Able to commute to and from client sessions
QUALIFICATIONS
Certified Personal Trainer (NCCA, DEAC, or NBFE accredited organization)
Certified in CPR/AED
High school diploma or GED equivalent
1 year of personal training
Good communication skills; verbal, written, and technical
Have a basic understanding of nutrition and healthy living practices
Knowledgeable of a variety of exercise equipment and personal training methods
Clean Driver’s License

· Comply with company policies re: member/client billing and submittal of payroll data

REQUIRED EDUCATION, CERTIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The employee is required to stand, walk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

VALUABLE FINAL PRODUCT OF FITNESS DEPARTMENT
· Personal Training, TIO and Small Group Clients who achieve desired results, continue to purchase programs and packages
· Consistently achieves revenue and budget goals

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Involves instructional or program activities related to recreation, leisure, and fitness in an accredited environment provides first aid and emergency care as necessary, and responds to user / customer needs.

To see the salary range for this position (we recommend that you make a note of the job code and use that to look up): TCS Non-Academic Titles Search (ucop.edu)
Please note: The compensation ranges listed online for roles not covered by a bargaining unit agreement are very wide, however a job offer will typically fall in the range of 80% - 120% of the established mid-point. An offer will take into consideration the experience of the final candidate AND the current salary level of individuals working at UCSF in a similar role.
For roles covered by a bargaining unit agreement, there will be specific rules about where a new hire would be placed on the range.
To learn more about the benefits of working at UCSF, including total compensation, please visit: https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html
Department Description
UCSF Fitness and Recreation operates two fitness centers at UCSF. We provide fitness and wellbeing services to UCSF students, faculty, staff and community members through a broad range of fitness, recreation, aquatics, personal training, outdoor programs, and health and wellness programs. We make life better here by inspiring fitness and wellbeing for everyone. UCSF Fitness and Recreation’s mission is to enrich the human spirit, quality of life, and community at UCSF. We are passionate fitness and recreation professionals committed to doing quality work. We fulfill that mission by providing our members with exceptional service, knowledgeable staff, a wide variety of activities, and a clean environment. We are a customer service division, providing needed services on all UCSF campus sites and delivering these services with PRIDE: Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Diversity and Excellence.
Required Qualifications
One year or more of experience as a Certified Personal Trainer
Nationally recognized Personal Training certification
Working knowledge of program activity practices and procedures
Verbal and written communication skills in the English language, active listening, dynamic flexibility, critical thinking, multi-task and time management skills.
Ability to exercise independent sound judgment and employ reasoning skills.
Client service minded, entrepreneurial spirit and creative thinking skills.
Ability to successfully pass FBI and DOJ Criminal Check.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelors or Masters degree in Exercise Science or a related field of study strongly preferred.
Knowledge of campus policies and procedures.
Basic skills in computer programs relevant to job duties.
Rehab or injury management experience

License/Certification
Nationally certified CPR/AED certification – required
Nationally recognized Personal Training certification - required
Standard First Aid Training Certification - preferred
Dietary expertise or nutritional certification - preferred
Previous Personal Training experience in a gym/health club environment - preferred
About UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.
Pride Values
UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.
Equal Employment Opportunity
The University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Come join the fun!
We offer free lunches, uniforms, amazing benefits, a fun working environment, competitive pay rates, access to the PV school district based on Parents' employment, and free golf for employees!!!

About Rolling Hills Country Club:
Established in 1965, Rolling Hills Country Club is a private, family-friendly country club perched upon the rolling hills of Palos Verdes Peninsula with expansive skyline views of the Los Angeles Basin and San Gabriel Mountains. The construction of the new clubhouse and golf course in 2017 brought a new vision of excellence. A brand-new championship golf course designed by world-renowned golf architect, David McLay Kidd. The luxurious 70,000 sq. ft. clubhouse was designed by one of the most celebrated clubhouse architects in the West, Robert Altevers. Club amenities include a championship golf course, 400-yard double-sided driving range complete with nine regulation greens that can double as a Par 3 executive course, golf academy including state-of-the-art technology including Trackman, Boditrak, and SAM Putt Lab, tennis courts, athletic facility, aquatic center, kids club, an elegant spa, fine and casual dining, magnificent banquet event spaces, secluded conference rooms, stately locker rooms, and world-class service distinguishing Rolling Hills Country Club as the preeminent leader in the private club experience.
We are seeking a Personal Trainer for our Vistas Spa and Sports team. If you are someone who is motivated, energetic, enthusiastic, and you believe in excellence, this is the position for you.

Job Summary (Essential Functions)
The Vistas Personal Trainers provide one-on-one fitness instruction and develop programs and choose exercises. Trainers evaluate their clients' physical fitness and keep track of their progress. Trainers must be able to demonstrate the movements and exercises recommended. They also provide encouragement and support for the client and recognize the client's strengths and weaknesses.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Skills & Abilities:
Certification from a nationally recognized agency such as ACE, AFFA, ASCM, NSCA, and NSPA.
Current first aid, CPR, and other safety certifications when required by the client.
Ability to demonstrate equipment used for exercise training.
Excellent customer service skills and strong work ethic.
Efficient, well organized, and able to handle a variety of duties simultaneously.
Professional manner, discretion, and appearance.
Excellent verbal and written skills.
Energetic, enthusiastic, and motivational.
Strong team player.
Six months of related experience (preferred)
Normal work hours: Varied to include nights, weekends, and holidays.
Awareness of proper body mechanics to prevent injury.
This position required the ability to stand, stoop, kneel, crouch, bend, and talk
Have the ability to stand for up to 7 hours a day
Have the ability to regularly lift heavy weights, squat, bend, reach, and spot.
Have the ability to frequently lift and /or move up to 45+ pounds
The employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, feel or operate objects, tools, or controls; and reach with hands and arms.
Vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.
Adhere to meal and rest break periods and must clock in and out for all shift times

Education/Certifications:

College degree in physical education or related field preferred.

PRIMARY FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Sales Execution on Key Metrics

Sell and conduct private and small group training with members.
Assist members and encourage member involvement in private training.
Ensure accurate administration of client programs (measurement tracking, workouts, etc).
Arrive on time, prepared and attentive for training appointments.
Assist in revenue-generating activities (complimentary workouts, workshops, etc.).
Achieve personal monthly revenue objectives as set forth by the company in sessions, PT and supplement sales.
Conduct member tours, and complete sales when needed.
Member Experience

Focus on changing lives through Service, Science, and Sales.
Be a brand ambassador for Rolling Hills Country Club.
Conduct safe and effective private training sessions.
Maintain the organization and neat presentation of the fitness floor and training spaces.
Respond professionally to requests and inquiries from members and staff.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

In-depth knowledge of Private Training techniques from assessment to program design.
Must be able to adjust and operate all Fitness Equipment.
Knowledge of company policies, practices, and procedures, including emergency and safety procedures.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Friendly, enthusiastic, and positive attitude.
Ability to understand and follow oral and written instructions.
Possess a strong customer service focus.
Strong organizational and time management skills. Understands basic record-keeping practices.
Must be computer proficient with basic skills in Word and Excel.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
At MAC GYM we run things as should supposed to be.
You focus on what you love, coaching and training, and leave the sales and chasing new clients to us.
Here is What We Are Looking For:
First and foremost we are looking for a people person. We are known for our programs and coaching but in reality, we are in the customer service business and we work with people. One of the biggest reasons for our success is because we realize that our members are everything to our business and we do everything we can to get to know them and find out how can we motivate them and help them reach their goals.
Second, our trainers needs to be a life-long learner. One of our core values is "always learn-constantly improve". We're constantly learning something new and working on becoming better at what we do. We even give incentives to our coaches for continuing education.
Third, we're looking for a team player.
And last but not least we're looking for an enthusiastic, motivated, hard-working, and HIGH ENERGY PERSON (this is really important) to start working and coaching our clients as soonest possible.
About the Position
We currently offer mostly one-on-one one sessions and nutrition programs that motivate, educate, and support men and women to improve their health, fitness, and performance. Most of our programs include nutrition coaching, fitness testing, and body composition analysis.
If you are accepted for this position, you'll undergo a 2-4 week internship and training to learn our system. The majority of your training clients' hours vary. There will be some additional hours between for fitness assessments, coaching and consultations with clients, follow-ups with clients, training on our system, meetings.
Bottom line: After your initial training is over and you're ready to start. Mac Gym facility's offer a casual, fun environment, state-of-the-art training equipment, and the opportunity to learn the inner workings of a successful fitness business.
Oh yea, we’re also very fair, respectful, and appreciative. We like having fun and making money by providing highly valuable fitness services and products.
You will be compensated fairly, treated fairly and we will certainly look for ways to pay you more for your efforts if they warrant it. I want someone who enjoys working with people and making a difference in the lives of others - because that's what we do in our business.
Our current facility is located 40 N. Groesbeck Hwy., Mount Clemens, MI. 48043 and 31059 Harper Ave., St. Clair Shores, MI. 48082
Tasks We Need You to Perform
Deliver Comprehensive Health & Fitness Programs For Clients: You'll receive coaching and training on our fitness system and programs, but you'll be expected to deliver them in a fun, high energy, enthusiastic, educational, and supportive manner.
Tracking Client Progress: In order to ensure a client's success in our programs, you'll need to track clients' progress, current successes, and challenges, review client nutrition logs, and more, on a weekly basis. It will be your job to hold our clients accountable to his/her health and fitness program to ensure the best results possible.
Perform Fitness Evaluations: You'll need to perform a fitness assessment and test for: body composition, body weight, girth measurements, and various strength and flexibility tests. You do not need previous experience, but if you do, that's a bonus.
Demonstrate Proper Exercise Instruction: This is a big one. I need you to be able to provide proper coaching, instruction, and motivation during a client training session. You should have a working knowledge of the human body (i.e. muscles, movements, functions, etc.) and be able to provide appropriate exercises for the client's goals.
Provide Ongoing Health and Fitness Education: Our clients rely on us to service all of their health and fitness needs. It is your job as a fitness coach to provide our clients with health and fitness education on various topics that will empower them to lead healthy lives forever.
Required Skills
These are the skills you must already have in order to qualify for this position:
No Certification we will intern YOU- Some previous personal training or group training experience and understanding of human anatomy, physiology and biomechanics is beneficial but not required.
Basic nutrition knowledge: You've heard this one: "You can't out-train a bad diet". We believe in this and that is why most of our programs include the nutritional component included in the membership. Our next coach should understand the basic nutritional principles and be able to advise clients on proper nutrition.
Good Communication Skills: You will be talking with my clients, who are VERY important to me. You must be comfortable conversing in person and on the phone and know how to conduct yourself professionally, and deliver clear instructions to the clients. We'll teach you everything you need to do during a training session, but I can't teach you manners and professionalism.
People Skills and Personality: You must LOVE working with people! As mentioned above you must be very comfortable working with people. These are exciting training facilities and you must be able to show our clients energy and excitement while working with them.
CPR Certified: If you don't have one it’s not a problem you can easily get one in a day.
How to Apply
We're looking to hire the right (5) people as soon as possible. So if this job sounds good to you, then apply immediately.
Here is what we want from you:
Punctual and prepared for all appointments with clients or staff meetings
Passionate about fitness and coaching others with purpose while providing excellent customer service
Ability to motivate others to improve their overall fitness and health
Desire to help clients reach their health and fitness goals through proper cardiovascular, flexibility and resistance exercise
Knowledge of anatomy, functional exercise, basic nutrition, and basic exercise science
Conducts Fitness Assessments according to Company protocol
Educates members on current health and fitness issues and trends
Exceptionally member service oriented and possesses outstanding communication skills
Ability to design exercise programs tailored to the needs of specific clients/goals
Ability to demonstrate and teach exercises while providing feedback on technique
Ability to execute individual fitness program design in a safe and effective manner
Understands the importance of maintaining accurate and current client files
Dedicated to maintaining personal integrity and personal health and fitness
Willingness to uphold Company protocol and policies
Attends mandatory and optional staff training classes
Promotes and sells personal training programs and services
Remains current on certifications and new trends in the industry
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Employee discount

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Are you a professional who thrives on working in a dynamic and collaborative environment, helping your clients envision and achieve their personal fitness goals? Do you seek a workplace which sets its trainers up for success and values each trainer’s unique contributions? Do you enjoy building long term relationships with clients and co-workers? If so, your needs and the needs of JCC Greater Boston may be aligned. We are seeking do add to our team of outstanding trainers. Under the supervision of the Fitness Director, Personal Trainers are responsible for managing and maintaining the fitness floor, being responsive to members by offering assistance and educating them on the safe and correct use of cardiovascular and weight training equipment. Additionally, Personal Trainers perform (Fit Plans) consultations and orientations/assessments, sell personal training packages, conduct one-on-one personal training sessions and answer fitness related questions. This is a part time position.
JCC Greater Boston is deeply committed to valuing and celebrating the uniqueness of each constituent. We welcome staff and participants from diverse backgrounds. While being proudly Jewish, we strive in every way to provide an open and welcoming setting for all, irrespective of personal practices, beliefs or background. We are guided by JCC Greater Boston core values - Belonging, Joyfulness, Collaboration and Transformation - which resonate with many who do not identify as Jewish.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Member Services
Perform member fitness center orientations (Fit Plans) based on JCC’s protocol, evaluate health history, conduct assessments, demonstrate equipment usage and develop a safe, effective workout plan.
Maintain a current online schedule, tracking appointments, check ins and payments.
Keep up-to-date on current JCC program offerings. Encourage new members to participate in other JCC program offerings.
Personal Training
Develop safe and effective exercise programs utilizing progression; programs are consistent with member’s goals/needs and within the scope of your education and knowledge you currently possess.
Represent the Fitness Center in a positive & professional manner at all times. Provide excellent customer service both to your clients and to others using the facilities.
Share responsibility for floor shifts with other trainers and Health & Wellness staff members. Circulate fitness floor and assist members in safe and effective exercise form.
Promote the JCC personal training program. This includes encouraging maintaining a client base and existing clients to continue as well as encouraging new sign ups (e.g. during fitness center orientations, fitness floor shifts and contacting interested members within 24 hours of receiving a lead).
Assist in development and implementation of new programs and classes.
Attend all mandatory Personal Trainer meetings, training and development.
While on shift, trainers will follow the Daily Action Plan and complete all items on the checklist
Fitness Floor
Maintain a clean, safe and organized fitness floor. Report equipment issues to the Fitness Director.
Enforce all Fitness Center, Cardio Deck & Indoor Track policies.
QUALIFICATIONS
Nationally accredited training certification (ACSM, NASM, NSCA, ACE)
CPR/AED Certified
5 years experience in the health and fitness industry
Computer skills including Windows, Microsoft Excel and Fitness related software
Must possess up-to-date knowledge of fitness protocols
JCC Greater Boston requires that new employees be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 at time of hire. The JCC will consider requests for medical or religious exemption that do not pose undue hardship or a direct threat to health or safety.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Must be able to work in a fast pace busy environment
Must be willing to work nights and weekend hours
Position calls for sitting, standing, and walking throughout the building
Routinely lifts and carries, moves and positions objects weighing up to 45 pounds
Occasionally lifts objects over 45 pounds
Able to work on site in Newton and adhere to JCC Greater Boston’s COVD safety protocols
JCC Greater Boston requires that new employees be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 at time of hire. The JCC will consider requests for medical or religious exemption that do not pose undue hardship or a direct threat to health or safety.
AGENCY INFORMATION
JCC Greater Boston values include: Belonging, Joyfulness, Collaboration and Transformation. The agency provides a variety of programs and services to children and adults in the Greater Boston Jewish community including: Early Learning Centers, summer camps, health and wellness programs, family engagement programs and cultural activities. The JCC is deeply committed to valuing and celebrating the uniqueness of each constituent. While being proudly Jewish, we strive in every way to provide an open and welcoming setting for all, irrespective of personal practices, beliefs or background.
Our vision is to create a vibrant and evolving Jewish community where everyone belongs. Our mission is to be at the heart of that community by:
creating a thriving community that nurtures meaningful and lasting relationships,
welcoming a growing and increasingly diverse set of individuals and families from all over Greater Boston,
supporting the building of unique identities rooted in Jewish values and deeper connections to Jewish life,
nourishing minds, bodies, and spirits through dynamic, innovative, and accessible experiences, and
expanding engagement by partnering closely with other organizations to ensure the continuing vitality of our community as whole.
