Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Department Overview:
Provide a safe, enriching environment, and build relationships with members. Provide testing and assessment using a variety of protocols. Design/prescribe and implement personalized fitness programs. Instruct members on proper exercise techniques.
Function/Duties of Position:
Provide personal training service by developing exercise prescriptions and programs for members. Prescribe flexibility, cardiovascular, and strength training exercises to assist members in goal achievement. Maintain member information and tracking. Build a repeat clientele.
Greet members by name. Take heart rates and blood pressures as needed. Evaluate, correct, and instruct members on proper exercise techniques. Proactively provide appropriate direction to members performing dangerous or harmful exercises. Maintain a safe and clean environment for members.
Perform health appraisals using approved protocols. Provide facility orientations.
Respond to all emergencies
Required Qualifications:
BS in exercise science or related health & wellness field.
Experience providing strength training, cardiovascular, and flexibility training principles and techniques. Skill in exercise testing and evaluation of test data. Experience in evaluating medications, contraindications and risk factors.
Strong customer service skills. Strong leadership abilities. Strong organizational skills. Excellent communication skills. Ability to communicate to members and staff in a courteous, friendly and professional manner. Ability to project and promote a healthy image. Ability to work independently, multi-task, be flexible and meet deadlines. Proficiency with MS Word and Excel.
Certification through a national organization such as ACSM, NSCA, NASM, ACE. BLS HeartCode or CPR, AED certification.
Preferred Qualifications:
MS in exercise science or related field.
Two years experience in the fitness industry.
BLS HeartCode and First Aid certification
Additional Details:
This position requires a high level of physical activity, including standing for extended periods of time, demonstrating equipment use, and spotting. Ability to lift a minimum of 80 pounds essential.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM
At VASA Fitness, we want to create an uplifting experience for everyone by offering inclusive, accessible, and on-trend fitness. The foundation of our brand is rooted in a culture centered on unity, passion, love, integrity, fun, and trust. Because our culture is alive—embodied by members and team members alike—VASA is a place where lives are changed because of authentic connections made within our supportive community.
We offer a competitive, all-encompassing benefits package which includes healthcare benefits for employees who work 20+ hours per week. All employees receive two complimentary gym memberships—one for themselves and another to give away—plus 401k options.
30+ hours per week employees:Paid Time Off (hourly),Health, Dental, Vision Benefits and Paid Parental Leave (in addition to above)
40 hours per week employees:Flexible Vacation Plan (salary) & Paid Holidays (in addition to above)
Come join VASA Fitness a passionate, fun, and united team!
VASA is hiring Personal Trainers! All experience levels welcome!
Less than 1-year of personal training or coaching experience? No problem! We would love to teach the way VASA Personal Training Coaches help our members get healthy, feel strong and be happy!
Experienced personal trainer or coach? We can't wait for you to connect with our members!
JOB TYPE:Full-time & Part-time available
Job Description
POSITION TITLE:PersonalTrainer
REPORTS TO:Fitness Team Lead
FLSA Status:Hourly
COMPENSATION
Base pay is $12.00 per hour. Average pay is $18.00 per hour!
Client Training Session Range: $22.00-$33.00 per hour!
Semi-private Training Session Range $44.00-$66.00 per hour!
PURPOSE
The personal trainer is a trusted team member who guides clients to success on their health and fitness journey. They do this through providing a world class training experience through our UPLIFT values and a caring and connected approach in every session. The Personal Trainer will prioritize, plan, and execute tactics to acquire new and retain existing clients.
DELIVERABLES
The Personal Trainer will meet on a regular basis with the FTL to plan, prioritize and execute tactics to ensure success on the deliverables, which include but are not limited to, the following:
Acquisition of new and retention of existing clientele.The Personal Trainer is responsible for performing all activities relative to the acquisition and retention of personal training clients.
Schedule and deliver complimentary PT sessions. Personal Trainers schedule then deliver personal training sessions for existing VASA members and execute on all processes and procedures for the success of each client.
Personal Trainers are agile in their training approach.This includes facilitating & adjusting exercise programming to fit the exact needs of each client. The Personal Trainer will demonstrate care & create connection throughout the duration of the client journey.
Createan approachable environment in and around the Personal Training Cage. This includes interacting with members, clients & guests in a friendly, fun, energetic & inclusive way. Personal Trainers will also demonstrate consistency in appearance, safety protocols, and cleaning activities.
Create a supportive, connected community for all clients.This includes utilizing the VASA programs, tools & resources, to deliver meaningful personal trainer check-ins, coaching and encouragement in the on-going success of each client.
Requirements:
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
The competencies for successful performance in this role include, but are not limited to, the following:
CPR/AED Certification (must obtain within the first 30 days of employment).
Open minded with an ability to learn new approaches and can think outside the box.
Optimistic mindset with a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude.
Passionate about fitness and helping people live a healthy lifestyle.
Great problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills
PREFERRED (NOT REQUIRED) QUALIFICATIONS
Previous personal training experiencea plus.
Additional certifications relative to Personal Training.
NCAA-accredited Personal Training Certification or industry related degree.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
About us
The Fitness Studio is coming to The Shops at Piper Glen in South Charlotte May 15th, 2023. The facility is a 1200 sqft state of the art private botique studio that will cater to the Piper Glen and surrounding community. It will specialize in private one on one and small group personal training and some larger group classes in time. Other services will include 3D body composition testing, nutritional services and corporate wellness. The website is www.TheFitnessStudioCharlotte.com
Looking for two trainers for this unique and rare career opportunity. Prefer someone who can bring a book of business but not mandatory. Building studio from the ground up and looking for people who plan on a long term career and building a very large clientele base. Location is very high traffic and studio will be marketed very well. Trainers chosen will be expected to market themselves and be responsible for building thier own clientele along with turning leads into clients. Only two trainers will be chosen and no more in the future. This is an opportunity to basically be your own boss and have a fantastic facility to operate in with state of the art tools. Will pay on a high commission split % of training revenue.

Work with the client to develop a training plan based on their goals and needs
Encourage clients to push themselves to their limits but not beyond them.
Correctly spot clients using spotting techniques.
Teach clients how to use weights and machines correctly.
Oversee the exercising of clients.
Explain the purpose of exercises to clients.
Advise clients about general nutrition for health and disease prevention.
Monitor client progress by measuring bodyweight, body fat, and body measurements, and operating the Styku 3D body composition machine.
Train 1-4 people at a time. Familiar with group circuit training.
Market gym services to community.
Can train larger group classes if needed.
Market themselves and build their own clintele base
Attend local industry events to promote studio
Work side by side with owner to build clientele base and market studio.
Requirements:
4 year degree in sports, nutrition or fitness related studies
Minumum 5 years as a Personal Trainer
Certification from nationally recognized personal training course
Broad availability
Must live locally to the gym (sessions can start as early as 5am).
Available for early morning, evening and Saturdays a MUST.
Experience in small group and larger groug personal training.

Title: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer- Health, Dental Insurance and PTO!
Job_Description:
GROWING COMPANY looking for: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer (No Experience Needed!) with HEALTH BENEFITS, DENTAL INSURANCE and PAID TIME OFF!
MUST BE ABLE TO WORK WEEKDAYS AND SATURDAYS. PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS JOB POSTING IF YOU CANNOT WORK SATURDAYS. THANK YOU!
Ever wondered what it would be like to do a job that you truly love! The ability to change people’s lives daily. Our team here at Time Saver Fitness could not be more delighted to announce that we are actively hiring for an Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer!
POSITION: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer
What makes us unique? We specialize in just two, twenty-minute workouts per week with each one of our clients! While many positions require a certification and experience in the field, we can with full certainly say, NO experience is needed. In fact, we have our own full certification here at Time Saver Fitness where you will become an expert in the field of physical fitness learning and gaining extensive knowledge and skills based on human anatomy and body mechanics giving you the ability to help any client achieve the results they truly desire. In fact, while most have to pay for a full certification, we will PAY YOU! Yup, we will pay you to go through Time Saver Fitness’ full certification. Once hired, a trainee will go through our extensive certification lasting roughly a month and a half to two months.
The type of person we’re looking for? Surprisingly enough, someone that has NO experience in the fitness industry is someone we prefer. Due to our full certification, we will teach you everything you need to know. If you are dedicated to helping others through past experiences, have a vibrant, outgoing, and kind personality then there is a strong change we want to hear from you. Lastly, if you TRULY TRULY, enjoy helping others out and fit the qualities outlined, there is a chance you might be the PERFECT fit for our team.
PERSONALITY CHARACTERISTICS: We are looking for an amazing person with the personality to go along with it! Are you ENERGETIC, UPBEAT, HIGH LEVEL OF INTEGRITY, MOTIVATED, LOOK AT THE GLASS HALF FULL, A PASSION FOR LIFE and want to change the way someone lives?
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Coach clients through each of their 20-minute, One-on-One personal training sessions paying attention to form, control, body mechanics, breathing and level of determination
· Coach clients through each of their 20-minute workouts to help them achieve the goals and results they are looking for
· Despite client’s limitations or injuries, always give positive reinforcement
· Give basic nutrition advice to clients should they inquire about it
· During each shift, ALWAYS abide by Time Saver Fitness’ 6 Core Company Values
· Go above and beyond for your team and clients
· Have fun and do what you love! You’re changing client’s lives forever!
PART TIME: We are currently looking to fill a part time position with the potential of full time in the future. Yes! If desired, we would love to make you full time as we continue to grow and expand. SATURDAYS AN ADDITIONAL MUST!
EXPANSION: Time Saver Fitness has helped so many clients that not only are we hiring but we are growing too! Our second location in Lakewood Ranch is now open with more locations to come.
UPWARD MOBILITY: If you have the desire for training clients and management too, be rest assured there is opportunity for facility management and upward mobility in the future THROUGHOUT one of our locations.
EXPERIENCE: No experience is needed! Due to our extensive two-month certification, we will certify you! In fact, well even PAY YOU to go through certification!
EDUCATION: A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred but certainly not required or needed.
PAY AND COMPENSATION: We believe that pay is really important too! Our pay scale we feel is extremely generous at $17-$18 per hour!
HEALTH BENEFITS: We’re truly really excited to mention that we offer Health Benefits to all employees! YES…you read it correct. With healthcare so important in this day an age, we’re REALLY HAPPY to be able to offer such a rare benefit within the fitness industry.
DENTAL BENEFITS: We are super excited to offer Dental Insurance to all staff should they decide to opt into it.
PAID TIME OFF (PTO): Within the fitness industry, PTO is something that is rare or never heard of. Here at Time Saver Fitness, we feel that PTO is important for all staff, thus all staff are given it each year.
LOCATION: The facility we are currently hiring for is in the heart of Sarasota Downtown and Lakewood Ranch.
WHEN ARE WE LOOKING TO HIRE: Immediately should someone be the right fit for our team!
HOW TO APPLY: Submit your most current resume to email address in this posting. Once submitted, you will be invited to Time Saver Fitness’ Hiring Seminar. The Hiring Seminar will include an overview of Time Saver Fitness, job description and 1-1 BRIEF interview.
We would love to have you join our AMAZING team! Please call or email so that we can begin the application process!

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Crunch Fitness is the fastest growing fitness company in the industry. We are expanding at an unprecedented pace across the globe. Currently we’re looking for passionate team members to help power the growth of our Michigan market. We have 9 locations open with a total of 30 locations slated for the market. Our growth is your opportunity to learn and grow with us.
If you are passionate about changing peoples lives, dedicated, and love to have fun we would love to connect with you. We are a growth mindset company that invest equally in our people and our product.
Job Description:
Our Personal Trainers provide customized fitness programs to our members while educating and guiding them on proper nutrition, cardiovascular exercise, resistance training and attaining a healthier lifestyle. Clients sign up with a personal trainer to be motivated, educated, and held accountable while working towards their fitness goals. By definition, a personal trainer is a fitness professional possessing the knowledge, skills and abilities for safe and effective exercise and fitness program design, instruction and assistance for the purpose of reaching personal health and fitness goals. This career path has a much higher profile than ever before and we are committed to assisting our dedicated and driven staff members in the development of their skills and professional growth.
Expectations and Responsibilities:
Punctual and prepared for all appointments with clients or staff meetings
Passionate about fitness and coaching others with purpose while providing excellent customer service
Ability to motivate others to improve their overall fitness and health
Desire to help clients reach their health and fitness goals through proper cardiovascular, flexibility and resistance exercise
Knowledge of anatomy, functional exercise, basic nutrition, and basic exercise science
Conducts Fitness Assessments according to Company protocol
Educates members on current health and fitness issues and trends
Exceptionally member service oriented and possesses outstanding communication skills
Ability to design exercise programs tailored to the needs of specific clients/goals
Ability to demonstrate and teach exercises while providing feedback on technique
Ability to execute individual fitness program design in a safe and effective manner
Understands the importance of maintaining accurate and current client files
Dedicated to maintaining personal integrity and personal health and fitness
Willingness to uphold Company protocol and policies
Attends mandatory and optional staff training classes
Promotes and sells personal training programs and services
Remains current on certifications and new trends in the industry

Title: Personal Trainer PRN

Job Summary:
Responsible for providing users of the facility with a personalized fitness and healthy lifestyle program, which includes assessment of their fitness needs and then prescribing an exercise/lifestyle plan that will assist the users in achieving their goals. Ability to design and implement a physical enhancement exercise regimen for an individual or small group, including special disease populations and/or community wellness programs. Assists with other facility service responsibilities, including supervision of fitness programs, educational class instruction, group exercise class instruction, equipment cleanliness and preventive maintenance, policy enforcement, incentive programming, and fitness floor coverage for delivering excellent customer service. Performs personal training sessions with members, achieving monthly session targets, as established by the facility. Displays comprehensive knowledge of anatomy and physiology as it relates to exercise in the adolescent through geriatric population.

Prefer a minimum of two hundred (200) hours of experience as a personal trainer and/or fitness instructor.

The Stamford JCC is looking for a personal trainer that is passionate and committed to the lifestyle and culture of fitness, health, and wellness! Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Summary:
This Personal Trainer position is a independent contractor, works for the Club on a contractual, 1099 hourly fee basis, and is responsible for one-on-one personal training sessions and teaching Group Circuit & Weight Training classes as needed. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated, have a strong work ethic, and possesses a mature, pleasant personality. The candidate enjoys a challenging environment, is reliable, well-mannered, responsible, healthy, and discrete. The right candidate works well alone and with others, and is good at time management.
Essential Functions, Duties, and Responsibilities:
Responsible for facilitating and providing members and clients with safe and effective fitness instruction while providing high level customer service and hospitality.
Works in and maintains work areas in a neat, clean, and safe manner.
Reports to and works closely with the Fitness Director to produce progressive and effective Personal Training programming and classes.
Qualifications:
Must possess a nationally recoginized personal training certification, and able to provide a copy of certification obtained through a PMA Certified Program with a minimum of 200 hours in training.
3+ years experience in teaching private clients and group classes. A certification and/or background in Corrective Exercise is strongly preferred. Candidates with less than 3 years of experience will be considered.
First aid and CPR/AED Certification is required.
Must carry and provide certificate of insurance for professional liability insurance.
Good communication and customer service skills required.
Professional manner, discretion and appearance strongly desired.
The ability to hear within normal parameters is required.
The ability to comprehend and communicate in spoken word in English is required; other language competency is helpful and desirable.
Compensation:
· Compensation commensurate with qualifications and experience.
TO APPLY:
Interested applicants should reply to this posting by including your current resume and cover letter.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
We are looking for the right person to join our team of professional trainers here at Train for Life. Be a part of an environment committed to helping all members and employees develop into their best selves.
The Job:
You will be conducting fitness consultations and building a clientele here at Train for Life. Design state of the art fitness programs for members who hire you as a trainer. The majority of the job is servicing personal training sessions and providing our members with top level service and customer care.
The Team:
Train for Life is a locally owned and operated fitness facility in Chapel Hill. The personal training staff consists mostly of combat athletes who are also interested in strength and physical fitness training. All of the current staff does Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, Boxing, Kickboxing, Wrestling, or some combination of those. If you aren't doing those things yet then don't let that stop you from joining the team. We will have a good time trying to talk you into it.
The Perks:
One of the nice things about working here is that after your 30 day probationary period you will get a gratis membership to all of the programs in the gym.
You will receive expert level sales training and business management training from our fitness director.
You will have access to one of the most committed and affluent membership bases in the area.
You will be able to make your own schedule.
After your probation period we will refund you 50% of any continuing education courses you take, show certification for, and do a 30 minute presentation on at a team meeting.
What we are looking for:
We are looking for an energetic individual who is ready to hustle in order to make a living in exercise. An ability to operate in a team is a must. Loyalty, honesty, and integrity are the key attributes we are looking for here. If you are able to listen and learn then we will make sure you are successful.

Title: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer- Health, Dental Insurance and PTO!
Job_Description:
GROWING COMPANY looking for: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer (No Experience Needed!) with HEALTH BENEFITS, DENTAL INSURANCE and PAID TIME OFF!
MUST BE ABLE TO WORK WEEKDAYS AND SATURDAYS. PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS JOB POSTING IF YOU CANNOT WORK SATURDAYS. THANK YOU!
Ever wondered what it would be like to do a job that you truly love! The ability to change people’s lives daily. Our team here at Time Saver Fitness could not be more delighted to announce that we are actively hiring for an Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer!
POSITION: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer
What makes us unique? We specialize in just two, twenty-minute workouts per week with each one of our clients! While many positions require a certification and experience in the field, we can with full certainly say, NO experience is needed. In fact, we have our own full certification here at Time Saver Fitness where you will become an expert in the field of physical fitness learning and gaining extensive knowledge and skills based on human anatomy and body mechanics giving you the ability to help any client achieve the results they truly desire. In fact, while most have to pay for a full certification, we will PAY YOU! Yup, we will pay you to go through Time Saver Fitness’ full certification. Once hired, a trainee will go through our extensive certification lasting roughly a month and a half to two months.
The type of person we’re looking for? Surprisingly enough, someone that has NO experience in the fitness industry is someone we prefer. Due to our full certification, we will teach you everything you need to know. If you are dedicated to helping others through past experiences, have a vibrant, outgoing, and kind personality then there is a strong change we want to hear from you. Lastly, if you TRULY TRULY, enjoy helping others out and fit the qualities outlined, there is a chance you might be the PERFECT fit for our team.
PERSONALITY CHARACTERISTICS: We are looking for an amazing person with the personality to go along with it! Are you ENERGETIC, UPBEAT, HIGH LEVEL OF INTEGRITY, MOTIVATED, LOOK AT THE GLASS HALF FULL, A PASSION FOR LIFE and want to change the way someone lives?
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Coach clients through each of their 20-minute, One-on-One personal training sessions paying attention to form, control, body mechanics, breathing and level of determination
· Coach clients through each of their 20-minute workouts to help them achieve the goals and results they are looking for
· Despite client’s limitations or injuries, always give positive reinforcement
· Give basic nutrition advice to clients should they inquire about it
· During each shift, ALWAYS abide by Time Saver Fitness’ 6 Core Company Values
· Go above and beyond for your team and clients
· Have fun and do what you love! You’re changing client’s lives forever!
PART TIME: We are currently looking to fill a part time position with the potential of full time in the future. Yes! If desired, we would love to make you full time as we continue to grow and expand. SATURDAYS AN ADDITIONAL MUST!
EXPANSION: Time Saver Fitness has helped so many clients that not only are we hiring but we are growing too! Our second location in Lakewood Ranch is now open with more locations to come.
UPWARD MOBILITY: If you have the desire for training clients and management too, be rest assured there is opportunity for facility management and upward mobility in the future THROUGHOUT one of our locations.
EXPERIENCE: No experience is needed! Due to our extensive two-month certification, we will certify you! In fact, well even PAY YOU to go through certification!
EDUCATION: A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred but certainly not required or needed.
PAY AND COMPENSATION: We believe that pay is really important too! Our pay scale we feel is extremely generous at $17-$18 per hour!
HEALTH BENEFITS: We’re truly really excited to mention that we offer Health Benefits to all employees! YES…you read it correct. With healthcare so important in this day an age, we’re REALLY HAPPY to be able to offer such a rare benefit within the fitness industry.
DENTAL BENEFITS: We are super excited to offer Dental Insurance to all staff should they decide to opt into it.
PAID TIME OFF (PTO): Within the fitness industry, PTO is something that is rare or never heard of. Here at Time Saver Fitness, we feel that PTO is important for all staff, thus all staff are given it each year.
LOCATION: The facility we are currently hiring for is in the heart of Sarasota Downtown and Lakewood Ranch.
WHEN ARE WE LOOKING TO HIRE: Immediately should someone be the right fit for our team!
HOW TO APPLY: Submit your most current resume to email address in this posting. Once submitted, you will be invited to Time Saver Fitness’ Hiring Seminar. The Hiring Seminar will include an overview of Time Saver Fitness, job description and 1-1 BRIEF interview.
We would love to have you join our AMAZING team! Please call or email so that we can begin the application process!

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
DC: Wellness (Unscheduled, Day Shift) -
Our mission is to continue the teaching and healing ministry of Jesus Christ. Our core values are compassion, excellence, humility, integrity, justice, teamwork and wholeness.
The Personal Trainer performs fitness assessment and creation of a personal exercise prescription for clients and other LLU entities. Performs other duties as needed.
High School Diploma or GED required. Bachelor’s Degree in kinesiology, exercise physiology or related fields preferred. Minimum one years of related experience preferred. CPR and Basic First Aid certification required within 90 days of hire. American Council on Exercise (ACE), American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM), National Academy of Sports Medicine (NASM) and National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA) certification preferred.
Familiarity with fitness machines and other equipment. Familiarity with basic principles of cardiovascular training, strength and resistance training, proper stretching and exercise techniques, and appropriate safety guidelines. Ability to work with clients with existing health risks and/or conditions. Knowledge of fitness assessments, performing exercise movements and assessments of injured clients. Able to speak in English with professional quality; Able to relate and communicate positively, effectively, and professionally with others; work calmly and respond courteously when under pressure; collaborate and accept direction. Think critically; manage multiple assignments effectively; organize and prioritize workload; work well under pressure; problem solve; recall information with accuracy; pay close attention to details; work independently with minimal supervision. Able to distinguish colors as necessary; hear sufficiently for general conversation in person and on the telephone, and identify and distinguish various sounds associated with the workplace; see adequately to read computer screens, and written documents necessary to the position.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Company: GYMGUYZ of PA, MD, VA, and DC
Job_Description:
If you like to hunt for your personal training clients in an overcrowded fitness facility, stay at the gym. If you want a turnkey book of business and the flexibility of being mobile, look no further than GYMGUYZ!

GYMGUYZ personal trainers bring the workout to their clients and customize programs for private, semi-private or group instruction. As a GYMGUYZ trainer, you will be coached to become an elite personal trainer while developing your skills for career progression within the GYMGUYZ family. We provide education, partnerships with experts in the industry and want you to love experiencing a new workplace every day.

Successful trainers at GYMGUYZ help clients achieve their goals, assess progress, and build relationships that turn into repeat business and referrals.

If you became a personal trainer to TRAIN clients and not FIND clients, you should apply NOW!

Trainers like you make us the #1 in-home personal training company! This is a part time position.

Benefits/Perks

Competitive compensation rates commensurate with experience
No Sales - unless specified in advance
Flexible of being mobile
Schedule – part-time and full-time opportunities
Bonus opportunities/ incentives
Recertification education discounts
Other employment benefits
Opportunity for career growth
Great team to work with!

Company Overview

GYMGUYZ is # 1 in Home Personal Training! We are the global leader in location-based fitness and NJ's largest personal training company. We are a team of highly skilled, energetic, and driven individuals. GYMGUYZ continues to grow rapidly locally and internationally. GYMGUYZ team members provide convenient, customized, and creative workouts in the setting of our client's choice. We are a highly collaborative team that runs on FUEL (Fun, Unity, Earnings, and Leadership). Team members enjoy benefits that include competitive compensation rates, discounts, and complimentary continuing education, other benefits, unlimited growth potential, and an outstanding culture!

GYMGUYZ has been rated by TheStreet.com as the “# 1 Hottest Franchise to Invest In” and recognized by Entrepreneur Magazine in its “Top 100 Fastest Growing Franchises" since 2016! GYMGUYZ is proud to be recognized on the 2018, 2019, and 2020 Entrepreneur's Franchise 500 list! Be part of a team that's changing the fitness industry!
This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to GYMGUYZ Corporate.

Title: Personal Trainer
Company: The Atlantic Club, Red Bank Partners
Job_Description:
Experienced Personal Trainer
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
· Demonstrate a personal commitment to meeting the needs of members and guests
· Perform a customer service role by assisting members with their exercise programs, encouraging members to reach their fitness and wellness goals, and handling member concerns and complaints quickly and effectively
· Demonstrate correct/safe use of all weight and cardiovascular equipment when working a floor shift, training private clients, or conducting small groups
· Set up all equipment for personal training clients
· Ensure safety of all members, clients, guests; monitor safe operation of all fitness equipment
· Follow department SOP’s for reporting equipment issues and placing out of order signage
· In addition to customer service, floor trainers are responsible for maintaining and cleaning fitness floor and equipment
· As an appointment trainer, follow all SOP’s as outlined in department training manual
· Comply with all company policies re: member/client personal information and client records
· Comply with company policies re: member/client billing and submittal of payroll data
· Maintain required certifications and attend trainings
· Conduct client interviews and counsel members on exercise recommendations based on fitness evaluations as well as members’ needs and goals
· Assist in development and implementation of club programs and events
· Attend and participate in all staff related meetings and other required activities
· Check emails/bulletins regularly and respond when required in a timely manner
· Behave as a role model by leading and promoting a healthy lifestyle
· Maintain positivity when working with members, clients, colleagues, and guests
· Seek opportunities for personal and professional growth
· Dress professionally, according to the current dress appearance policy and required department uniform
· Actively market, promote, and sell personal training, small group training and other special programs to acquire new members and retain existing members
· Encourage members to take advantage of other club services and programs
· Recommend changes for programming and services in line with current market trends
· Use Company software to record schedule availability
· Other duties as assigned by management
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
· Must be able to manage time effectively
· Must be able to market personal training and obtain clients
· Requires excellent interpersonal skills and customer service orientation
· Must enjoy communicating and working with people
REQUIRED EDUCATION, CERTIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE
· Must have a minimum of two years of education in the field of exercise science or a related field and at least two years’ experience in a similar position; or a Bachelor’s degree in exercise science or a combination of education and experience
· Nationally recognized personal training certification (NSCA, ACE, NASM, ACSM preferred. Other certifying bodies and/or specialty certifications will be considered.)
· Must have current CPR, First Aid, and AED certifications (must be obtained within 60 days of hire)
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
· Must be able to physically demonstrate proper usage of equipment, including weights of 25 – 50 lbs. While performing duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with arms and hands; and hear or talk. The employee is required to stand, walk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
· Must be able to spot problems and assist clients when working on floor – lift, stretch, bend, squat, twist, reach
· Must be able to set up equipment and move weights up to 50 lbs.
VALUABLE FINAL PRODUCT OF FITNESS DEPARTMENT
· Personal Training, TIO and Small Group Clients who achieve desired results, continue to purchase programs and packages
· Consistently achieves revenue and budget goals
· Satisfied members, clients and employees

Title: Certified Personal Trainer (temporary, part-time) - Campus Recreation at Yates Field House – Georgetown University
Job_Description:
Located in a historic neighborhood in the nation's capital, Georgetown offers rigorous academic programs, a global perspective, exciting ways to take advantage of Washington, D.C., and a commitment to social justice. Our community is a tight knit group of remarkable individuals interested in intellectual inquiry and making a difference in the world.
Requirements
Certified Personal Trainer (temporary, part-time) - Campus Recreation at Yates Field House – Georgetown University
Georgetown’s Personal Training Program provides students and members with an opportunity to participate in a program that encourages and supports a healthy lifestyle in a fun environment. Research indicates that regular participation in well-designed physical education lessons that support the holistic development of students can enhance the physical literacy of students. Exercise can be an effective component of a stress-management program, and all types of exercise can be beneficial for stress-management. Collegiate recreation participation may hold the key to academic performance; recent studies show a rise in students’ GPA and likelihood of graduation as their exercise and physical activity behaviors increased.
Supporting Georgetown University’s c ura personalis value, the Certified Personal Trainer offers individualized attention to participants, providing a unique exercise opportunity. They design and lead clients through safe and effective individual workouts; and work one-on-one with students and members to help them reach their personal fitness goals and help to promote living a healthy lifestyle.
Work Interactions
Reporting to the Director of Fitness and Wellness at Yates Field House, the Certified Personal Trainer interacts with their peers, in addition to Georgetown University faculty and staff, students, and members, allowing them to become a positive influence in the community, encouraging individuals to partake in a holistic, healthy lifestyle.
Qualifications
National certification from a reputable certifying organization - for example, ACE, ACSM, NASM, CSCS, NSCA
CPR/AED/First Aid certification
Engaging and professional approach
Self-motivation with passion for helping individuals achieve their fitness goals
Knowledge of basic anatomy, physiology, biomechanics, workout structure, and cueing proper exercise technique/form
Work Mode: On Campus. Please note that work mode designations are regularly reviewed in order to meet the evolving needs of the University. Such review may necessitate a change to a position’s mode of work designation. Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
PERSONAL TRAINER
Role and Responsibilities
Personal Trainer is responsible for managing the fitness floor, being responsive to members and guests by offering assistance, and educating Active Wellness members on the safe and correct use of cardio and weight training equipment. This person also performs assessments, provides package prescriptions, answers fitness and wellness related questions, and sells personal training packages.

Specific Responsibilities
Essential Functions
Sell and deliver personal training sessions to clients
Schedule and conduct new member onboarding sessions
Assist with new member outreach and follow-up with low users
Assist members in using safe and effective exercise form during their workouts
Maintain a clean, safe and orderly fitness floor, racking weights. Includes picking up loose towels, water bottles, magazines, cleaning equipment, etc.
Perform fitness assessments (movement and posture assessments, blood pressure checks, body composition tests) as requested by members
Support, teach and encourage members to meet his/her fitness goals
Assist in development and implementation of new fitness programs/classes
Administer emergency care to members and guests in need of assistance
Work as a TEAM with all other departments
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by supervisor
Other Functions
Be knowledgeable about all programs and activities offered by MJCC
Promote club services and activities
Assist with keeping the club well stocked and clean
Attend MJCC meetings and trainings
Handle injury and illness and security incident reporting
Qualifications and Education Requirements
Communication skills, customer service oriented
Operational knowledge of resistance training equipment and proper form
Knowledge of anatomy, biomechanics
Knowledge of injury prevention and basic rehabilitation
Knowledge of basic movement and posture assessments and body composition assessments
Ability to calculate target heart rate
Basic knowledge in nutrition
Four (4) years college degree in fitness related field or certificate from accredited 2-year program at a university preferred
Minimum one (1) NCCA or NBFE accredited certification
Previous health club personal training experience is a plus.
Must be detail oriented, organized and highly responsive with a commitment to customer service
Strong verbal communication skills
Basic computer skills, customer service skills, results oriented, ability to multitask, and commitment to the fitness industry
AED/CPR/First Aid Certified
National Personal Training Certification(s) required (see approved Certification, Licenses and Permits list) as well as modality specific certifications as required by role (if applicable)
Proof of citizenship or legal status
Physical and Working Conditions
Ability to take the responsibility for the health and safety of others
Ability to stand for several hours in a same shift; ability to lift 25 lbs
Fitness club environment
Must follow OSHA and MJCC safety standards

Title: Personal Trainer : Part time In Person/Remote
Job_Description:
JOB SUMMARY
You demonstrate the desired skills, behaviors, and mindset to create and deliver effective programs and experiences both in person and virtually. You must be able to work in a collaborative, fast-moving, and ambiguous environment while managing time effectively and be willing to lead tasks and projects to completion. Skills, behaviors, and mindset include but are not limited to:
Skills:
You efficiently design experiences with the users in mind
You articulately deliver and display effective communication skills
Behaviors:
You influence others to achieve results
You develop an inclusive environment both in person and virtually
Mindset:
You are motivated by being part of a team
You are adaptable and able to adjust to ever changing environments
JOB DESCRIPTION
Primary Responsibilities:
Program Design - Using BOOM's methodology and philosophy, you successfully design customized programs for users of varying abilities and goals with an emphasis on quality movement, careful instruction, and safe results.
Team Approach- You work well in a team setting and put the BOOM philosophy, a client centric focus at the forefront.
Deliver Instruction- You skillfully lead users through sessions both virtually and in person, while demonstrating proper movement quality to ensure maximum levels of success for all participants.
Administer Assessments- Routinely schedule and perform BOOM consultations and assessments for users in order to better understand their abilities, goals, and limitations.
Represent the BOOM Brand- Proudly represent the team both virtually and in person during meetings, video, and special events. You clearly articulate the scope of service delivery to users in a creative and thoughtful manner.
Developing Skill Sets- Vigorously seek out opportunities to learn and grow. Welcome feedback and dialogue around your own performance and work to build off of your strengths.
Solve Problems- Utilize creative solutions to provide the highest level of customer service and ensure no barrier stands in the way of users and their goals.
Marketing and Sales- comfortable selling and marketing yourself and the BOOM program to prospective companies and clients.
Share Insight- Effectively communicate to all. You are willing to share thoughts, concerns, and opportunities to those around you and work toward an identified common goal.
Preferred Qualifications:
· Completed Bachelor's Degree or higher
· Nationally recognized certification, preferably NSCA-CSCS, NASM or ACSM
· Minimum 2 year’s internship/work experience in fitness industry and overall interest and lifestyle surrounding wellness
· Open to evolving technologies and display excellent computer and technological skills
· Ample understanding and efficiency with Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Zoom
· Effective interpersonal communication skills, both written and verbal
· High energy, with ability to use your voice to motivate and inspire users of all fitness levels
· Ability to create and deliver an instructional experience both in person and digitally
Pay: Competitive– years of experience will dictate
Hours: 10-15 hours/week to start
Start Date: March 2023
Location: West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and LA area
Website: www.boomteam.com
Social: @boomteamusa

Title: Certified Personal Trainer (temporary, part-time) - Campus Recreation at Yates Field House – Georgetown University
Job_Description:
Located in a historic neighborhood in the nation's capital, Georgetown offers rigorous academic programs, a global perspective, exciting ways to take advantage of Washington, D.C., and a commitment to social justice. Our community is a tight knit group of remarkable individuals interested in intellectual inquiry and making a difference in the world.
Requirements
Certified Personal Trainer (temporary, part-time) - Campus Recreation at Yates Field House – Georgetown University
Georgetown’s Personal Training Program provides students and members with an opportunity to participate in a program that encourages and supports a healthy lifestyle in a fun environment. Research indicates that regular participation in well-designed physical education lessons that support the holistic development of students can enhance the physical literacy of students. Exercise can be an effective component of a stress-management program, and all types of exercise can be beneficial for stress-management. Collegiate recreation participation may hold the key to academic performance; recent studies show a rise in students’ GPA and likelihood of graduation as their exercise and physical activity behaviors increased.
Supporting Georgetown University’s c ura personalis value, the Certified Personal Trainer offers individualized attention to participants, providing a unique exercise opportunity. They design and lead clients through safe and effective individual workouts; and work one-on-one with students and members to help them reach their personal fitness goals and help to promote living a healthy lifestyle.
Work Interactions
Reporting to the Director of Fitness and Wellness at Yates Field House, the Certified Personal Trainer interacts with their peers, in addition to Georgetown University faculty and staff, students, and members, allowing them to become a positive influence in the community, encouraging individuals to partake in a holistic, healthy lifestyle.
Qualifications
National certification from a reputable certifying organization - for example, ACE, ACSM, NASM, CSCS, NSCA
CPR/AED/First Aid certification
Engaging and professional approach
Self-motivation with passion for helping individuals achieve their fitness goals
Knowledge of basic anatomy, physiology, biomechanics, workout structure, and cueing proper exercise technique/form

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Personal Trainer trains Y members and community participants on strength training equipment, free weights and cardiovascular equipment on a one to one basis or small group training. The Personal Trainer is also responsible for informing and serving YMCA members and volunteers in a premier fashion. They are expected to emphasize member service, character development, the mission statement and to work with membership retention and promotion.

$150 Hiring Bonus

OUR CULTURE:
The YMCA of Greater Kansas City’s mission and core values are brought to life by our culture. It’s who we are, who we aspire to be and how we show up every day. We are cause-driven. We don’t just show up, we show up with purpose. We are welcoming: we are open to all. We are a place where you can belong and become. We are genuine: we value you and embrace your individuality. We are hopeful: we believe in you and your potential to become a catalyst in the world. We are nurturing: we support you in your journey to develop your full potential. We are determined: above all else, we are on a relentless quest to make our community stronger beginning with you.

Responsibilities:
Work one-on-one (or small groups) with members and community participants.
Maintain safety by following YMCA and national certification guidelines.
Maintain attendance records and reports.
Maintain the cleanliness of the wellness area.
Be a team player with all staff.
Must notify appropriate staff of any unsafe conditions, needed repairs, complaints, accidents, or injuries immediately.
Qualifications:
18 years of age or older.
Associate’s degree in health related field of study, or equivalent.
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
National accredited certification in Personal Training or related area.
Current First Aid & CPR.
Current license (as needed).
Able to relate to people on all levels in a friendly and consistent manner.
Able to reflect a positive attitude.
Experience with sports specific training desired

Title: CERTIFIED PERSONAL TRAINER
Job_Description:
The Spa at Yellow Creek is committed to making a positive difference in the lives of others every day. When you join our team, you'll have the satisfaction of helping people relax and destress in an environment that is positive, progressive, and empowering.
WE OFFER • Health insurance after 90 days (full-time employees) • 30% off treatments and products. Enjoy all of our luxurious spa services and products at a discount • Earned vacation time • Free gym access

CERTIFIED PERSONAL TRAINER
The Gym at Yellow Creek is committed to making a positive difference in others' lives every day. When you join our team, you'll have the satisfaction of helping people reach their fitness goals and maintain a healthy lifestyle in an environment that is positive, progressive, and empowering.
For the past 13 years, we have offered an integrated approach to health and wellness through our spa and fitness facilities. We are seeking an established and experienced full-time Certified Personal Trainer with an engaging wellness-oriented mindset to add to our existing team. We will support any efforts that you make to develop a client base and work closely with you to establish programs such as boot-camps, clinics, specialty classes, and personal training sessions.
Candidates must be available weekday mornings and evenings and must be flexible to accommodate the client's schedule. The candidate must have at least one of the following personal training certifications: NASM, NFPT, ISSA, NCCPT, IFPA, ACE, or NPTI.
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE
Is passionate about the fitness industry and strives for results for clients
Has a positive and outgoing personality
Enjoys what they do, pushes themselves to improve, and goes above and beyond
Displays a genuine team spirit, a flexible attitude along with the power of positivity
Is a responsible and reliable wellness-oriented individual with a strong work ethic
We will teach you what you need to know about working with our team, but a passion for helping others should be innate
Is willing to hustle to get new clients, but having an existing client base is a major plus!
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE
Understand the principles of physical fitness and proper exercise technique
Possess excellent customer service skills.
Be driven and motivated to self-promote and network.
Communicate clearly and concisely, both verbal and in writing.
Capable of adjusting and operating fitness equipment
Able to be coachable and is a team-oriented individual
PERSONAL TRAINER RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
Build a client base by conducting fitness assessments and demonstrating personal training value, including safe and proper exercise techniques
Prepare and deliver comprehensive fitness programs based on clients' goals
Motivate and inspire clients to get results through goal setting, frequent follow-up, and re-assessments to show progress
Provide high-quality hospitality to all members
Keep work areas clean and safe for clients and members, follow all cleaning and sanitation protocols
COMPENSATION: $13.00 to $22.00/hour

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Colorado Athletic Club Monaco
Denver, CO
A Wellbridge Company

Full-time/Part-time
We're looking for a Personal Trainer!

Who we are:
Colorado Athletic Club is Denver’s leading upscale athletic, aquatics, tennis and family fitness club with 7 convenient locations across Colorado’s Front Range. Our club supports the lifestyles of busy professionals, families, health enthusiasts and those who simply strive to be more active by providing a wide spectrum of unique fitness and wellness services.

What our Personal Trainers are all about:
Our Personal Trainers are committed to helping individuals reach their personal fitness goals. They specialize in the design and implementation of individualized programs and are skilled in the safe and proper use of machine weights, free weights and cardiovascular equipment.

Our Personal Trainers are energetic, provide exceptional customer service, and enjoy finding creative ways to keep clients motivated while assisting them in overcoming obstacles. Our most successful trainers have an entrepreneurial spirit yet appreciate the support from club management and our corporate office.

What you’re all about:
A passion for fitness and enjoy helping a wide variety of individuals reach their personal goals.
A solid work ethic and people know they can depend on you.
An NCCA accredited personal training program certification from one of the following organizations: AAPTE, ACTION, ACSM, ACE, NASM, NCCPT, NCSF, NESTA, NETA, NFPT, NSCA or Cooper Institute (To see a complete list of the accepted certification programs visit http://www.credentialingexcellence.org/p/cm/ld/fid=121).
A CPR and First Aid Certification.
Excellent verbal and promotional skills.
A minimum of 6 months of personal training experience is preferred.
A Bachelor’s degree in exercise physiology or a related area is definitely a plus.
Why we're a great company to join:
You’ll enjoy a complementary gym membership.
We provide state-of-the-art exercise equipment and resources.
We provide the opportunity to strategize, learn, lead and grow.
We provide medical, dental, vision and life insurance.
We offer company matching 401k
We offer short term and long term disability.
We offer AD&D and voluntary insurance.
We offer paid time off and holidays.
And much, much more!
*All benefits vary based on employee job status and including hours worked.
Compensation: $24.50 – $49.50 per hour + bonuses based on qualifications, experience and production.
Wellbridge owns and operates a variety of premiere athletic and tennis clubs across the country. Established more than 30 years ago with one location in CO, we have grown to 13 locations spanning 3 states (CO, NM & MD). We proudly employ more than 1,000 team members and serve a growing membership community of more than 20,000+ members.

We offer dynamic opportunities for our employees to develop their careers in a collaborative and empowering environment. Our culture encourages managers to be coaches, celebrates results through teamwork, and promotes innovative behaviors that contribute to a strong and dynamic environment. This allows us to live our mission of delivering the best for and through our employees, our members, and our community.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Fitness Coach

Who we are
At 24 Hour Fitness, we are dedicated to our mission of creating a healthier, happier world. We are passionate about providing a fitness community that is accessible, affordable, and welcoming to everyone. We're on the hunt for team members who are committed to being the best part of each other's day and who have a genuine desire to help our members achieve results they can feel proud of.
You're excited about this role because you will:
* Share your passion for fitness by helping members get started on their fitness journey, whether it's helping them discover new group fitness classes or becoming their personal trainer.
* Apply your ability to make genuine connections with people, seek to understand their unique needs, and prescribe the perfect fitness solution.
* Build a fitness community by being attentive during every training appointment, group session or class, meeting minimum productivity expectations servicing sessions. Your strong teaching skills and ability to connect with and motivate people with a wide variety of fitness levels will increase member retention and client acquisition.
You'll spend your days:
* Creating, maintaining, and regularly updating progress for each personal training client, following company guidelines, and delivering a positive fitness experience to members and guests. You'll do this through complimentary fitness assessments and both live and virtual personal or group training sessions.
* Demonstrating quality personal and small group training sessions leading to client acquisition and retention. You'll provide well-rounded fitness consultations for new and existing members and adjust programming to meet client needs.
* Generating new personal training business by interacting with new and existing members by phone, as they check-in and, when appropriate, while they work out. You use your passion for fitness and outgoing personality to build relationships and community within your four walls.
We're excited about you because you:
* Enjoy designing and delivering comprehensive fitness programs based on client goals, including suitable exercise selections. You'll develop programs that include varied fitness offerings, general nutrition guidelines and inspiring a healthy lifestyle.
* Are authentic, sincere and open-minded and bring your whole self to work -- you're positive, self-motivated, passionate about helping others, and eager to learn.
* Demonstrate integrity, dependability and flexibility; you are true to your word, and clients, members and team members can rely on you. You are comfortable using company systems to schedule personal training sessions and manage your time.
* Bring with you:
o Nationally recognized certification or degree in a related field.*
o The ability to lift heavy equipment, demonstrate movements and activities.
o CPR and AED certification required within 60 days of employment.
o Preferred: 1+ years as a certified trainer.
Availability
Part-Time or Full-time, with flexible availability across weekdays, weekends, and holidays to best serve our member community. This position does not typically have a set schedule as member and client needs vary.
This job posting is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to include all duties and responsibilities. The order in which duties and responsibilities are listed is not significant. See Job Description for further information about this job.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
JOB SUMMARY

Under the supervision of the Fitness Center Manager, this position is responsible for assisting clients in safely and effectively obtaining their fitness goals. Personal Trainers work with clients to identify fitness needs and develop and deliver custom training programs based on the clients’ goals, capabilities, and needs. The trainer must be a leader, role model, educator, motivator and advisor.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Job description
Personal Trainer (Part-time, potential for full-time)
This is currently a part-time opportunity, and candidate ideally is available for a mix of early morning camps (5am-8am, 9am-11am) several days per week, as well as some evening camps (4-7pm) throughout the week.
Burn Boot Camp is a trendsetting franchise fitness organization opening multiple locations throughout the United States including the Greater Fredericksburg, VA area. We are currently seeking a qualified Part-time Certified Trainer for our Burn Boot Camp Fredericksburg locations.
As a Burn Boot Camp Trainer, you will be responsible for delivering dynamic, challenging, & engaging workouts to members of all fitness levels. This position requires a strong ability to be a personal trainer in a group setting, motivating multiple clients and providing a positive community for change. A Burn Boot Camp Trainer focuses on a healthy lifestyle, a positive mindset, whole food nutrition, strength training and burst (HIIT) training, with the goal to create an amazing supportive environment that exceeds client's expectations every camp, every day!
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Deliver workouts to groups
Lead and motivate clients throughout HIIT workout
Must practice what you preach, lives a lifestyle similar to the way you want clients to live
Ensure safety of participants in regards to exercise technique
Knowledge on how to modify specific exercises to accommodate various skill levels
Attend weekly and quarterly fitness meetings and required educational presentations
Handle member concerns when applicable
Use Social Media daily to keep members engaged
Be fitness leader in our community
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Experienced Certified Personal Trainer. Must hold current fitness certification from an approved education company such as ACSM, ACE, NAMS, NCSA, AFFA, NFPT (NCCA Certified), OR be willing and ready to take the CPT within 30 days of hiring
Knowledge of physiology, exercise technique, and body mechanics
Ability to multi-task and stay organized
Positive, motivating and effective interpersonal communication skills
Desire and capacity to train all fitness levels
Must have current CPR/AED certification, or prepared to get certified within 7 days of hire
Excellent communication and customer service skills

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
PERSONAL TRAINER
Role and Responsibilities
Personal Trainer is responsible for managing the fitness floor, being responsive to members and guests by offering assistance, and educating Active Wellness members on the safe and correct use of cardio and weight training equipment. This person also performs assessments, provides package prescriptions, answers fitness and wellness related questions, and sells personal training packages.

Specific Responsibilities
Essential Functions
Sell and deliver personal training sessions to clients
Schedule and conduct new member onboarding sessions
Assist with new member outreach and follow-up with low users
Assist members in using safe and effective exercise form during their workouts

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
At MAC GYM we run things as should supposed to be.
You focus on what you love, coaching and training, and leave the sales and chasing new clients to us.
Here is What We Are Looking For:
First and foremost we are looking for a people person. We are known for our programs and coaching but in reality, we are in the customer service business and we work with people. One of the biggest reasons for our success is because we realize that our members are everything to our business and we do everything we can to get to know them and find out how can we motivate them and help them reach their goals.
Second, our trainers needs to be a life-long learner. One of our core values is "always learn-constantly improve". We're constantly learning something new and working on becoming better at what we do. We even give incentives to our coaches for continuing education.
Third, we're looking for a team player.
And last but not least we're looking for an enthusiastic, motivated, hard-working, and HIGH ENERGY PERSON (this is really important) to start working and coaching our clients as soonest possible.
About the Position
We currently offer mostly one-on-one one sessions and nutrition programs that motivate, educate, and support men and women to improve their health, fitness, and performance. Most of our programs include nutrition coaching, fitness testing, and body composition analysis.
If you are accepted for this position, you'll undergo a 2-4 week internship and training to learn our system. The majority of your training clients' hours vary. There will be some additional hours between for fitness assessments, coaching and consultations with clients, follow-ups with clients, training on our system, meetings.
Bottom line: After your initial training is over and you're ready to start. Mac Gym facility's offer a casual, fun environment, state-of-the-art training equipment, and the opportunity to learn the inner workings of a successful fitness business.
Oh yea, we’re also very fair, respectful, and appreciative. We like having fun and making money by providing highly valuable fitness services and products.
You will be compensated fairly, treated fairly and we will certainly look for ways to pay you more for your efforts if they warrant it. I want someone who enjoys working with people and making a difference in the lives of others - because that's what we do in our business.
Our current facility is located 40 N. Groesbeck Hwy., Mount Clemens, MI. 48043 and 31059 Harper Ave., St. Clair Shores, MI. 48082
Tasks We Need You to Perform
Deliver Comprehensive Health & Fitness Programs For Clients: You'll receive coaching and training on our fitness system and programs, but you'll be expected to deliver them in a fun, high energy, enthusiastic, educational, and supportive manner.
Tracking Client Progress: In order to ensure a client's success in our programs, you'll need to track clients' progress, current successes, and challenges, review client nutrition logs, and more, on a weekly basis. It will be your job to hold our clients accountable to his/her health and fitness program to ensure the best results possible.
Perform Fitness Evaluations: You'll need to perform a fitness assessment and test for: body composition, body weight, girth measurements, and various strength and flexibility tests. You do not need previous experience, but if you do, that's a bonus.
Demonstrate Proper Exercise Instruction: This is a big one. I need you to be able to provide proper coaching, instruction, and motivation during a client training session. You should have a working knowledge of the human body (i.e. muscles, movements, functions, etc.) and be able to provide appropriate exercises for the client's goals.
Provide Ongoing Health and Fitness Education: Our clients rely on us to service all of their health and fitness needs. It is your job as a fitness coach to provide our clients with health and fitness education on various topics that will empower them to lead healthy lives forever.
Required Skills
These are the skills you must already have in order to qualify for this position:
No Certification we will intern YOU- Some previous personal training or group training experience and understanding of human anatomy, physiology and biomechanics is beneficial but not required.
Basic nutrition knowledge: You've heard this one: "You can't out-train a bad diet". We believe in this and that is why most of our programs include the nutritional component included in the membership. Our next coach should understand the basic nutritional principles and be able to advise clients on proper nutrition.
Good Communication Skills: You will be talking with my clients, who are VERY important to me. You must be comfortable conversing in person and on the phone and know how to conduct yourself professionally, and deliver clear instructions to the clients. We'll teach you everything you need to do during a training session, but I can't teach you manners and professionalism.
People Skills and Personality: You must LOVE working with people! As mentioned above you must be very comfortable working with people. These are exciting training facilities and you must be able to show our clients energy and excitement while working with them.
CPR Certified: If you don't have one it’s not a problem you can easily get one in a day.
How to Apply
We're looking to hire the right (5) people as soon as possible. So if this job sounds good to you, then apply immediately.
Here is what we want from you:
Punctual and prepared for all appointments with clients or staff meetings
Passionate about fitness and coaching others with purpose while providing excellent customer service
Ability to motivate others to improve their overall fitness and health
Desire to help clients reach their health and fitness goals through proper cardiovascular, flexibility and resistance exercise
Knowledge of anatomy, functional exercise, basic nutrition, and basic exercise science
Conducts Fitness Assessments according to Company protocol
Educates members on current health and fitness issues and trends
Exceptionally member service oriented and possesses outstanding communication skills
Ability to design exercise programs tailored to the needs of specific clients/goals
Ability to demonstrate and teach exercises while providing feedback on technique
Ability to execute individual fitness program design in a safe and effective manner
Understands the importance of maintaining accurate and current client files
Dedicated to maintaining personal integrity and personal health and fitness
Willingness to uphold Company protocol and policies
Attends mandatory and optional staff training classes
Promotes and sells personal training programs and services
Remains current on certifications and new trends in the industry

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Colorado Athletic Club Boulder
Boulder, CO
A Wellbridge Company

Full-time/Part-time
We're looking for a Personal Trainer!

Who we are:
Colorado Athletic Club is Denver’s leading upscale athletic, aquatics, tennis and family fitness club with 7 convenient locations across Colorado’s Front Range. Our club supports the lifestyles of busy professionals, families, health enthusiasts and those who simply strive to be more active by providing a wide spectrum of unique fitness and wellness services.

What our Personal Trainers are all about:
Our Personal Trainers are committed to helping individuals reach their personal fitness goals. They specialize in the design and implementation of individualized programs and are skilled in the safe and proper use of machine weights, free weights and cardiovascular equipment.

Our Personal Trainers are energetic, provide exceptional customer service, and enjoy finding creative ways to keep clients motivated while assisting them in overcoming obstacles. Our most successful trainers have an entrepreneurial spirit yet appreciate the support from club management and our corporate office.

What you’re all about:
A passion for fitness and enjoy helping a wide variety of individuals reach their personal goals.
A solid work ethic and people know they can depend on you.
An NCCA accredited personal training program certification from one of the following organizations: AAPTE, ACTION, ACSM, ACE, NASM, NCCPT, NCSF, NESTA, NETA, NFPT, NSCA or Cooper Institute (To see a complete list of the accepted certification programs visit http://www.credentialingexcellence.org/p/cm/ld/fid=121).
A CPR and First Aid Certification.
Excellent verbal and promotional skills.
A minimum of 6 months of personal training experience is preferred.
A Bachelor’s degree in exercise physiology or a related area is definitely a plus.
Why we're a great company to join:
You’ll enjoy a complementary gym membership.
We provide state-of-the-art exercise equipment and resources.
We provide the opportunity to strategize, learn, lead and grow.
We provide medical, dental, vision and life insurance.
We offer company matching 401k
We offer short term and long term disability.
We offer AD&D and voluntary insurance.
We offer paid time off and holidays.
And much, much more!
*All benefits vary based on employee job status and including hours worked.
Compensation: $24.50 – $49.50 per hour + bonuses based on qualifications, experience and production.
Wellbridge owns and operates a variety of premiere athletic and tennis clubs across the country. Established more than 30 years ago with one location in CO, we have grown to 13 locations spanning 3 states (CO, NM & MD). We proudly employ more than 1,000 team members and serve a growing membership community of more than 20,000+ members.

We offer dynamic opportunities for our employees to develop their careers in a collaborative and empowering environment. Our culture encourages managers to be coaches, celebrates results through teamwork, and promotes innovative behaviors that contribute to a strong and dynamic environment. This allows us to live our mission of delivering the best for and through our employees, our members, and our community.

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
This position supports the work of the Y, a leading nonprofit committed to strengthening community through youth development, healthy living and social responsibility. Instructs individual member clients, provides excellent service to members in a safe, enjoyable, and positive environment that promotes member wellness and engagement in accordance with YMCA policies and procedures.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Conducts energizing, fun, safe, and educational training sessions.
Conducts fitness evaluations (e.g., step test, flexibility, resting heart rate, blood pressure, and heart rate) following the Y’s way to physical fitness protocol; uses information from evaluations to help members set and reach their fitness/wellness goals; perform follow up testing to ensure goals are being met (as per needed).
Builds effective relationships with members; helps members connect with each other and the YMCA.
Maintains working knowledge of wellness and trends to provide effective information and support to members.
Keeps accurate and confidential member records including health and wellness assessments, personal information, fitness routines and training schedules.
Demonstrates proper operation and correct use of fitness equipment; assists with exercise techniques and helps develop member’s knowledge of physiology and exercise.
Refrain from diagnosing injuries, offering medical advice and dispensing or endorsing any and all commercial health products especially nutritional supplements, vitamins, performance enhancing substances and pain relievers.
Follows YMCA policies and procedures; responds to emergency situations.
Adheres to YMCA’s core values of caring, honesty, respect, and responsibility.
Performs other duties as assigned.

LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES:
Advancing Our Mission & Cause: Engaging Community, Volunteerism, Philanthropy, Change Leadership
Building Relationships: Collaboration, Communication & Influence, Inclusion
Leading Operations: Critical Thinking & Decision Making, Fiscal Management, Functional Expertise, Innovation, Program/Project Management
Developing & Inspiring People: Developing Self & Others, Emotional Maturity

PAY RATE: $30-$45/hr +
QUALIFICATIONS:
Required certifications: CPR, First Aid, AED, national personal training certification (ACE, NETA, AFAA, NASM, ACSM, NSCA).
YMCA New Employee Orientation and Child Abuse Prevention Training within 30 days of hire.
Must obtain YMCA certifications within 6 months of employment, these include, but are not limited to, YMCA Principles of Healthy Lifestyles and YMCA Foundations of Strength & Conditioning.
At least one year of experience as a personal trainer preferred.
Continuing educations/renewals of certifications kept up to date and submitted to the supervisor on or before certifications expire.

WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Ability to conduct personal training sessions and activities relating to fitness.
Ability to perform all physical aspects of the position; including walking, standing, bending, reaching, and lifting.
Repetitive stooping and bending with occasional lifting of up to 20 pounds is required.
