Title: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer- Health, Dental Insurance and PTO!
Job_Description:
GROWING COMPANY looking for: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer (No Experience Needed!) with HEALTH BENEFITS, DENTAL INSURANCE and PAID TIME OFF!
MUST BE ABLE TO WORK WEEKDAYS AND SATURDAYS. PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS JOB POSTING IF YOU CANNOT WORK SATURDAYS. THANK YOU!
Ever wondered what it would be like to do a job that you truly love! The ability to change people’s lives daily. Our team here at Time Saver Fitness could not be more delighted to announce that we are actively hiring for an Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer!
POSITION: Entry Level Certified Personal Trainer
What makes us unique? We specialize in just two, twenty-minute workouts per week with each one of our clients! While many positions require a certification and experience in the field, we can with full certainly say, NO experience is needed. In fact, we have our own full certification here at Time Saver Fitness where you will become an expert in the field of physical fitness learning and gaining extensive knowledge and skills based on human anatomy and body mechanics giving you the ability to help any client achieve the results they truly desire. In fact, while most have to pay for a full certification, we will PAY YOU! Yup, we will pay you to go through Time Saver Fitness’ full certification. Once hired, a trainee will go through our extensive certification lasting roughly a month and a half to two months.
The type of person we’re looking for? Surprisingly enough, someone that has NO experience in the fitness industry is someone we prefer. Due to our full certification, we will teach you everything you need to know. If you are dedicated to helping others through past experiences, have a vibrant, outgoing, and kind personality then there is a strong change we want to hear from you. Lastly, if you TRULY TRULY, enjoy helping others out and fit the qualities outlined, there is a chance you might be the PERFECT fit for our team.
PERSONALITY CHARACTERISTICS: We are looking for an amazing person with the personality to go along with it! Are you ENERGETIC, UPBEAT, HIGH LEVEL OF INTEGRITY, MOTIVATED, LOOK AT THE GLASS HALF FULL, A PASSION FOR LIFE and want to change the way someone lives?
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Coach clients through each of their 20-minute, One-on-One personal training sessions paying attention to form, control, body mechanics, breathing and level of determination
· Coach clients through each of their 20-minute workouts to help them achieve the goals and results they are looking for
· Despite client’s limitations or injuries, always give positive reinforcement
· Give basic nutrition advice to clients should they inquire about it
· During each shift, ALWAYS abide by Time Saver Fitness’ 6 Core Company Values
· Go above and beyond for your team and clients
· Have fun and do what you love! You’re changing client’s lives forever!
PART TIME: We are currently looking to fill a part time position with the potential of full time in the future. Yes! If desired, we would love to make you full time as we continue to grow and expand. SATURDAYS AN ADDITIONAL MUST!
EXPANSION: Time Saver Fitness has helped so many clients that not only are we hiring but we are growing too! Our second location in Lakewood Ranch is now open with more locations to come.
UPWARD MOBILITY: If you have the desire for training clients and management too, be rest assured there is opportunity for facility management and upward mobility in the future THROUGHOUT one of our locations.
EXPERIENCE: No experience is needed! Due to our extensive two-month certification, we will certify you! In fact, well even PAY YOU to go through certification!
EDUCATION: A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred but certainly not required or needed.
PAY AND COMPENSATION: We believe that pay is really important too! Our pay scale we feel is extremely generous at $17-$18 per hour!
HEALTH BENEFITS: We’re truly really excited to mention that we offer Health Benefits to all employees! YES…you read it correct. With healthcare so important in this day an age, we’re REALLY HAPPY to be able to offer such a rare benefit within the fitness industry.
DENTAL BENEFITS: We are super excited to offer Dental Insurance to all staff should they decide to opt into it.
PAID TIME OFF (PTO): Within the fitness industry, PTO is something that is rare or never heard of. Here at Time Saver Fitness, we feel that PTO is important for all staff, thus all staff are given it each year.
LOCATION: The facility we are currently hiring for is in the heart of Sarasota Downtown and Lakewood Ranch.
WHEN ARE WE LOOKING TO HIRE: Immediately should someone be the right fit for our team!
HOW TO APPLY: Submit your most current resume to email address in this posting. Once submitted, you will be invited to Time Saver Fitness’ Hiring Seminar. The Hiring Seminar will include an overview of Time Saver Fitness, job description and 1-1 BRIEF interview.
We would love to have you join our AMAZING team! Please call or email so that we can begin the application process!

Title: Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Position Summary:

Make a difference and guide clients on their journey to reach their personal fitness goals. You will be part of a team that prides itself on creating a comfortable and safe space for people to make the differences they want in their life, such as losing weight or getting stronger. Utilize your profound knowledge of exercise science and nutrition to counsel clients on a one-on-one basis or in a small group setting and create an individualized fitness plan that is suited to each person’s physical abilities. Show off your strong customer service skills as you engage with clients and answer their questions about the gym equipment, products and services we offer, general health questions and more.
Primary Position Duties:
Be inspirational and goal oriented.
Provide personal evaluations to clients on their fitness level by reviewing their abilities, physical condition and overall health to ensure that all fitness plans are suitable.
Create personalized fitness routines that assist clients in reaching their fitness goals while remaining suitable to their current physical abilities.
Teach clients on the proper techniques for all exercises, especially when using more complicated equipment, to minimize the risk of injury.
Monitor clients on their status and make changes to their individual fitness plans based on any physical changes and increased or decreased fitness levels.
Be on time and prepared for every scheduled session/client. Give clients amble notice to reschedule and respond quickly to clients scheduling requests.
Enforce all gym policies and safety rules to reduce the chance of any accidents and to maintain a safe and comfortable environment in which clients can exercise.
Attend all scheduled meetings and training workshops.
Stay current with required certifications at all times.
Present training packages/options in a clear, professional, desirable manner.
Wear appropriate gym attire.
Inform clients on other healthy lifestyle changes to complement their fitness goals, such as a healthier diet or not smoking.
Perform emergency first aid when needed, including treating minor injuries with bandages or wrapping and administering ice.
In case of emergency, notify the Training Director or a Fitness Evolution Manager immediately.
Plan and safely lead small group training sessions taking in account clients of varying ability levels and fitness goals.
Maintain awareness of all Fitness Evolution services, products, daily promotions and programs.
Lead group fitness classes when appropriate and necessary.
Maintain a working knowledge of how to use all equipment in the facility
Clean, maintain and return all fitness equipment so that it is ready for clients to use at any time. Report any issues to Training Led or a Fitness Evolution Manager immediately.
Position Requirements:

CPR/AED and accredited personal training certification required. Excellent health and fitness level preferred must be able to lift 100 lbs.
Education or Skills:
Current accredited personal training certification
Willingness to work with clients of varying fitness levels
Cheerful, friendly, even-tempered and professional
Highly motivated
Experienced with Health Club operations
Excellent Customer Services Skills specifically, excellent verbal communication skills
Strong work ethic and integrity
Experience in Sales

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Crunch Fitness is the fastest growing fitness company in the industry. We are expanding at an unprecedented pace across the globe. Currently we’re looking for passionate team members to help power the growth of our Michigan market. We have 9 locations open, with one location going into presale, with a total of 30 locations slated for the market. Our growth is your opportunity to learn and grow with us.
If you’re passionate about changing peoples lives, dedicated, and love to have fun we’d love to connect with you. We are a growth mindset company that invest equally in our people and our product.
Job Description:
Our Personal Trainers provide customized fitness programs to our members while educating and guiding them on proper nutrition, cardiovascular exercise, resistance training and attaining a healthier lifestyle. Clients sign up with a personal trainer to be motivated, educated, and held accountable while working towards their fitness goals. By definition, a personal trainer is a fitness professional possessing the knowledge, skills and abilities for safe and effective exercise and fitness program design, instruction and assistance for the purpose of reaching personal health and fitness goals. This career path has a much higher profile than ever before and we are committed to assisting our dedicated and driven staff members in the development of their skills and professional growth.
Expectations and Responsibilities:
Punctual and prepared for all appointments with clients or staff meetings
Passionate about fitness and coaching others with purpose while providing excellent customer service
Ability to motivate others to improve their overall fitness and health
Desire to help clients reach their health and fitness goals through proper cardiovascular, flexibility and resistance exercise
Knowledge of anatomy, functional exercise, basic nutrition, and basic exercise science
Conducts Fitness Assessments according to Company protocol
Educates members on current health and fitness issues and trends
Exceptionally member service oriented and possesses outstanding communication skills
Ability to design exercise programs tailored to the needs of specific clients/goals
Ability to demonstrate and teach exercises while providing feedback on technique
Ability to execute individual fitness program design in a safe and effective manner
Understands the importance of maintaining accurate and current client files
Dedicated to maintaining personal integrity and personal health and fitness
Willingness to uphold Company protocol and policies
Attends mandatory and optional staff training classes
Promotes and sells personal training programs and services
Remains current on certifications and new trends in the industry

Pay: $2,000.00 - $5,000.00 per month
Benefits:
Employee discount

Commission pay

CPR Certification (Preferred)
personal training certification (Preferred)

Job_Description:
About us
South Florida Physical Therapy and Sport is a multi-purpose facility in Fort Lauderdale, FL. We are professional, agile, and our goal is to deliver a comprehensive approach of returning the athlete to their sport or activity. SoFloPT will provide greater opportunityies to help higher level athletes and more people in South Florida.
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and knowledgeable personal trainer and performance coach to join our team. The successful candidate will have a passion for fitness, a positive attitude, and a desire to help clients and athletes reach their fitness goals.

Develop personalized fitness plans for clients based on their individual needs, preferences, and goals.
Lead one-on-one training sessions and group fitness classes, demonstrating proper technique and providing modifications as needed.
Monitor client progress and adjust fitness plans as necessary to ensure continued improvement.

Maintain a clean and safe workout environment, ensuring equipment is properly maintained and sanitized.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to motivate and inspire clients to achieve their goals.
Flexibility in scheduling, including early mornings, evenings, and weekends.
Experience in designing and implementing safe and effective fitness programs for clients of all fitness levels.
If you are a highly motivated and knowledgeable individual with a passion for helping others reach their fitness goals, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit your resume showcasing your relevant experience and qualifications.

Title: Personal Trainer

Job Summary
The Personal Trainer is responsible for performing assessments, providing package prescriptions, answering fitness and wellness related questions, and helping to sell personal training packages. They should also be responsive to members and guests by offering assistance, and educating ERJCC fitness members on the safe and correct use of cardio and weight training equipment.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Be professional with all members, employees, clients, and co-workers.
Schedule and conduct FIT sessions.
Support, teach, and encourage members to meet their fitness goals.

Help members on the fitness floor.
Provide members and employees with knowledge of exercise principles.
Contact members to schedule fitness program updates.
Work together as a team with all departments.

OTHER FUNCTIONS

Title: Assistant Coach, Strength and Conditioning/Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
Under the general supervision of the Head Strength & Conditioning Coach, with joint reporting to the Assistant AD for Fitness and Recreation, the Assistant Strength and Conditioning Coach is responsible for creating and providing physical instruction and direction to varsity student-athletes and members of the Babson Athletic and Recreation Complex (BRAC).
Key Responsibilities:
Strength & Conditioning Coach:
Assists in the design, implementation, and monitoring of a year-long comprehensive strength and conditioning program for 22 varsity sports.
In conjunction with Head Strength and Conditioning Coach, applies specific protocols for all varsity sport programs that are designed to ensure respective sports’ programs are consistent throughout the Department of Athletics and Recreation.
Communicates with, and advises, head coaches about strength and conditioning pre and post games, and pre and post practice activities for student-athletes.
Assists in direct supervision and instruction of weight training and conditioning activities for varsity sports programs. Performs continual assessment of physical performance of sport teams. Provides motivation and feedback in order to ensure proper execution of training techniques.
Works directly with Sports Medicine department to provide advice and assistance in the prevention of athletic injuries. Assists in the rehabilitation of injured athletes in conjunction with the Sports Medicine department.
Assists in the daily oversight and maintenance of the varsity strength and conditioning areas, coordinating staffing of weight room/strength facilities, and identifying and purchasing needed strength and conditioning equipment.
Assists the Head Strength and Conditioning Coach regarding the budget ($1 - $250,000), monitors and assists with budget preparation and record keeping (not vouching).
Establishes and maintains relationships with regional and national athletic associations related to sports performance.
Serves on standing and ad hoc committees directly or indirectly related to Athletics.
Personal Trainer
Ensures a safe and healthy environment for exercising.
Gathers information on the client’s fitness expectations. Develops, documents, and implements one-on-one programs matching the client’s needs and goals of and provides guidance on how to accomplish these goals.
Arrives to training sessions in advance of the scheduled time to set up training area and greet clients.
Reports any equipment/facility problems to the management team.
Assists patrons and clients via spotting, answers questions on exercise and technique, and provides demonstrations of fitness equipment.
Ensures compliance with rules and regulations of Babson College.
Attends all scheduled meetings and professional development courses.
Assumes additional responsibilities as required.
Supervises:
Work Study Students (2)
Education Requirements:
Minimum Level of Education Required: Bachelor’s Degree. Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) certification through the National Strength and Conditioning Association or equivalent.
Position Knowledge/Skills & Abilities Requirements:
At least 1+ year of strength and conditioning experience and certified in First Aid, CPR/AED.
Demonstrated knowledge of and commitment to coordinating programs for intercollegiate athletes in all areas of strength and conditioning as well as speed, agility, plyometric, flexibility, and cardiovascular training.
Possess a willingness and ability to support a diverse and inclusive environment.
Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to relate to and motivate student-athletes.
Strong computer skills including proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint).
Strong supervisory skills.
Ability to maintain confidentiality.
Knowledge of NCAA rules and regulations.
Must be well organized, dress appropriately in uniform, and begin and end all sessions on time.
Working Conditions:
Regular physical exertion, walking and exposure to weather required; ability to travel; ability to work nights and weekends.
Must have had a valid unrestricted U.S. Driver’s License for one year, and maintain throughout employment an insurable (as determined by the College’s insurer’s criteria) or a satisfactory driving record; must successfully complete and pass the College’s vehicle training program within the first 30 days of employment; annual or more frequent review of employee’s driving record based on the College insurer’s criteria; and safety training as required by management.
Babson College requires all Babson faculty and staff members authorized to work on our campuses or any other property owned or controlled by the College to verify that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19. We have extended our vaccination policy to require a COVID-19 booster shot for all eligible community members as well. Students, faculty and staff must provide booster vaccination information by February 1 or within 21 days of becoming eligible for a booster (unless granted a medical accommodation or religious exemption). Requests for medical accommodation or religious exemption should be addressed directly to Human Resources.
This seasonal/intermittent position is contingent upon continued satisfactory performance and a continued need for skills/courses.

Title: Certified Personal Trainer
Job_Description:
The 4 things you need to be a personal trainer at Fitness 1440 White House are a personal training certification, a strong work ethic, a great personality, and a desire to help people.
A Fitness 1440 personal trainer is the key to a member's success in the gym. Our trainers must have a heart for people and be able to connect with all walks of life. Trainers provide quality personal training services to all of our members and guests. Unlike other gyms, all of our members are treated as "paying customers," whether they purchase personal training or not.
All members receive quality workouts and workout upgrades on a monthly basis. Our trainers must be able to:
Multi-task
Promote themselves and the gym
Follow systems and procedures
Inspire and motivate all Fitness 1440 members
coach members in a group training environment
At Fitness 1440 we offer our members the option of personal training, as well as group training, We are hiring a trainer to coach our members one on one, as well as in a group setting. We are a new facility, with great opportunity for trainers. Our facility has indoor turf area, large outdoor training center, heart rate technology throughout the club, In body scanner available to clients, as well as power plates, stretching table, and hyperbole therapy tools.
Our aggressive compensation plan allows our trainers to earn incomes far above industry standards. Trainers touch lives each and every day. A Fitness 1440 trainer must love being in the gym and exude the fitness lifestyle.

Title: Flag Football Referee - $22/hr - Educational Benefits Provided
Job_Description:
Underdog Sports Leagues is looking for referees for our adult (21 and over) flag football leagues. We love hiring people who are interested in learning, so we offer college scholarships, student loan reimbursement and contributions to 529 college savings plans for our referees.
We certify our own referees, so if you don’t have experience refereeing, that’s not a hindrance for us. We have made many people who have never officiated a game over the years into great referees.
We run our leagues year-round on nights and weekends, so this is not just a seasonal job, but one that will have hours year-round.
Here’s what we offer:
Underdog’s Educational Program: After working 100 hours in a calendar year, we offer $500 to go towards your choice of:
College Tuition
Student Loan Debt*
Your child’s 529 educational savings plan*
(*a small number of vested hours are required before debt or 529 becomes a choice)
Flexible Scheduling: You will have the opportunity to block out times and dates where you are not available, and we won’t schedule you for those block outs.
The number of hours you work is also flexible. Some referees want 4 hours a week, some want 15-20. As long as you’re able to communicate that with us, we’re able to work with your schedule.
$22 a game: Games are scheduled on the hour and you will generally get 3-4 games for a weeknight shift and between 3 and 8 games for a weekend shift.
Bonuses for continuing referee education
The ability to become certified in multiple sports (after your initial sport certification)
What Underdog is Looking for:
· The ability to communicate and diffuse conflicts
· The ability to relate to and empathize with our players.
· We believe that dependability is an ability. If you are not dependable, you will not make it with us.
· Pride in doing a good job
· Being able to enjoy facilitating other people’s fun.
· A solid knowledge of football rules
· You must be over 18 years old
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $22.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Referral program
Tuition reimbursement
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability
Work Location: Multiple Locations

Title: Referee
Job_Description:
Company Description

Founded and headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland in 2010, Volo is a community based organization with more than 300,000 users across the US. Our users leverage Volo to organize, meet, communicate and play within their community through fitness and social activities. Whether it's a performance sport like soccer, or a social activity like cornhole, Volo provides something real. Real interaction, real activity, real fun, and real impact.
Volo is a movement—for people and by people who want to connect more meaningfully with each other. We are a grassroots uprising, helping others actually see who they’re connecting with, and share experiences over the length of a season.
Proof We Are Awesome
Ranked Among Inc-5000 Fastest Growing Companies
Serving more than 9,000 kids in free youth programs
Over 300,000 Adult Participants Nationwide
8 City Markets & Counting...

Job Description

Referees are responsible for understanding and enforcing rules and safety guidelines in a friendly, competitive environment. This is a part-time, contract (1099) role, great for anyone who likes being outside, enjoys sports, and is looking for supplemental income. Volo is looking for referees for the following sports:
Kickball
Softball
Volleyball
Basketball
Soccer
Flag Football
Responsibilities:
Ensure a safe, fun, social and fair environment for all players
Understand and kindly and fairly enforce each sport’s rules
Communicate with the office regarding any equipment, rule issues, player issues, etc.

Qualifications
Must have played the sport before
Must be available for a minimum of eight weeks, as follows:
Weekday availability from 5:45pm-10:30pm
Weekend availability between 9am - 7pm
Must have reliable transportation to and from field locations
Must be able to pass Volo referee certification test

Additional Information

What We Look For:
People with a passion for sports and social activities
Must value punctuality and professionalism
Prior referee experience a plus, but not required
Experience in diffusing challenging situations a plus
Volo is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. We do not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or company policy. We strive to create a healthy and safe workplace and we prohibit harassment of any kind.
Volo partners with TeamWork Online, connecting people to sports jobs, careers, and internships for more than 30 years. Visit our page here to learn more.

Job_Description:
Job Title: Athletic Field Monitor
FLSA Status: Non-exempt
Hours: Part-time (under 30 hours a week) Seasonal
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Vesta Property Services provides property management and related services to developers of planned unit communities and residential associations. Headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, Vesta offices are strategically located throughout the Sunshine State. Vesta employs over 1,000 trained and educated professionals providing a wide spectrum of services to residents of more than 300,000 homes in over 300 communities.
SUMMARY
Referee and Monitor of Athletic Events. A referee or simply ref is the person of authority in a variety of sports who is responsible for presiding over the game from a neutral point of view and making on-the-fly decisions that enforce the rules of the sport, including sportsmanship decisions such as ejection.
QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum age is 15. Available to referee at least 5 Saturdays of the 8 week season. Ability to make quick decisions and blow a whistle, loud.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Ability to run up and down the field as the ball is played. Setting up and taking down equipment. Picking up trash and dumping in the dumpster.
WORK ENVIRONMENT: Competitive but friendly and fun.
BENEFITS:
One of the many advantages of working at Vesta Property Services and its family of companies are the great benefits that we offer to you and your eligible dependents. We offer benefits that foster the health and well-being of you and your family such as medical, dental and vision coverage along with programs to enhance your financial security such as disability, life insurance and a 401 (k) retirement plan just to name a few. Vesta benefits are offered to full-time employees (30+ hours per week).
AAP/EEO Statement
We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
DRUG FREE WORKPLACE
In compliance with the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988, Vesta Property Services has a longstanding commitment to provide a safe, quality-oriented and productive work environment consistent with the standards of the community in which the company operates. Alcohol and drug abuse poses a threat to the health and safety of Vesta Property Services employees and to the security of the company's equipment and facilities. For these reasons, Vesta Property Services is committed to the elimination of drug and alcohol use and abuse in the workplace.
OTHER DUTIES MAY BE ASSIGNED
The above statements reflect the general information considered necessary to descript the principle functions of the job and should not construed as a detailed description of all work requirements that may be inherent in the position. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Referral program

Title: Referee
Company: Boys & Girls Clubs of King County
Job_Description:
Now offering for a limited time up to $600 sign-on incentive ($300 paid upon hire and $300 paid after 6 months of employment)
At Boys & Girls Clubs of King County, we are taking youth programming to a new level. We are a leader in youth development, providing a safe, affordable place for kids and teens during critical out-of-school time. Our Clubs offer life-changing programs and services to more than 20,000 youth throughout the greater Seattle area.
As the third largest major metro Boys & Girls Club organization in the United States, we have a rich history serving King County youth. If you are passionate about youth development, love to connect with people, have a proven track record of results with youth, and want to be part of an extraordinary team, Boys & Girls Clubs of King County is for you!
Opportunity Overview: ATHLETIC STAFF
Support the Program Director in facilitating pre-designed programs in an assigned area. Expected to communicate with and motivate youth in a positive manner. Majority of responsibility is working directly with youth, ensuring their safety, well-being and development through interactive play and other activities as directed.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible for creating and implementing weekly program calendars for summer.
Contribute to ensuring a healthy and safe environment while helping to ensure that facilities, equipment and supplies are maintained.
Contribute to planning, developing, implementing and evaluating programs, services and activities.
Ensure a productive work environment.
Prepare activities which ensure that a culturally and developmentally appropriate program is offered.
Develop positive interactions with children and their families.
Ensure that all rooms are maintained to high standards of safety; are organized and neat.
Transport small groups of children in a safe and careful manner on field trips using a Club twelve passenger van, walking or using public transit.
Meet regularly with the staff and director to ensure the smooth running of all programs.
Work assigned shift, with an expectation to be flexible.
Complete other duties as assigned.
RELATIONSHIPS:
Internal: Maintain close, daily contact with Club staff (professional and volunteer), Club members, and supervisor. Communicate daily to receive/provide information, discuss issues, explain or interpret guidelines/instructions.
External: Support external contact as instructed with community groups, schools, member’s parents and others as directed by supervisor.
QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
High School diploma, GED, or currently enrolled in high school.
Youth development experience preferred.
Knowledge and/or experience working with a non-profit youth development agency, Boys & Girls Club experience preferred.
Good organization and attention to detail, professional presence, strong customer relations skills and ability to maintain strict confidentiality.
Understanding of youth development principles, ability to motivate youth in a positive way.
Ability to learn and support new ideas for the good of the Club.
Minimum 1 year of experience with school age children preferred.
Able to communicate effectively with children and other adults.
HOURS: Variable Hour - Under 30 hrs
LOCATION: Sammamish Boys & Girls Club, 825 228th Ave NE Sammamish, WA
PAY RATE: $21/hr
FLSA Non-exempt, hourly
Benefits of working with us include:
PTO & Paid Holidays
Access to Transit/Flexible Spending Cards
Eligibility for Free Medical Insurance through the WA Health Exchange
Growth and training opportunities
DISCLAIMER:
The information presented indicates the general nature and level of work expected of employees in this classification. It is not designed to contain, or to be interpreted as, a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, qualifications and objectives required of employees assigned to this job.
All offers are contingent upon passing a thorough background check including a National Criminal History Background check.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING ENVIRONMENT:
The physical demands and characteristics of the work environment described here are representative of those occurring in the performance of the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the essential functions of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY AND NON-DISCRIMINATION
Boys & Girls Clubs of King County (BGCKC) is committed to equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. BGCKC does not discriminate with regards to hiring, assignment, promotion or other conditions of staff employment because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected under local, state or federal law.
In accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, upon request, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of our positions.

Title: Paintball and Airsoft Referee
Job_Description:
About Us

We are a destination for not only paintball and airsoft enthusiasts, but we also host corporate events and facilitate family gatherings and have been doing so for almost 30 years.

We are looking for part-time Team Members to join our team as Referees, Cashiers, and Rental Attendants in a family friendly, exciting, and fast paced environment. We are looking for individuals with exceptional customer service skills, who can work in a team-oriented environment.

Team Members will:
monitor game play and players on and off the field
enforce the safety rules
perform safety rules debriefing of customers
chronograph paintball and airsoft markers
Demonstrate excellent customer service
Assist guests in payment and registration
Enforce the safety rules of the park
Issue rental equipment to guests
and other tasks as needed by management.
Potential candidates should enjoy working with a team focused on delivering an exceptional customer service experience.

Pay Rate

Pay Rate is Texas Minimum wage
Discounted entry for the employee (after introductory period)
Discounted entry for family (after introductory period)
Discounts on merchandise (after introductory period)
In addition to:
Have a positive and cheerful attitude that will enable you to achieve the highest level of customer service.
excellent communication skills.
Work well in a fast-paced, busy environment, and stay calm under pressure.
Must be able to stand, sit, reach, grasp, squat, bend, run for extended periods of time; must be able to lift 25 lbs. daily.
Must be okay working in an outdoor environment
Must be able to use walkie-talkie radios and whistles.
Must be willing to work on weekends and holidays (Saturday &/or Sunday).
Be computer proficient.
Must be willing to cross train between different positions (i.e. Roles may include Cashier & Equipment Rental Clerk)
Paintball and/or Airsoft experience preferred but not required.
Giant Party Sports is a perfect part-time weekend job for college students or those looking for a second weekend only job!

If you feel you meet these qualifications and are looking for a part-time weekend job in a fun and exciting environment, please apply!

Title: Basketball Referee
Job_Description:
BASKETBALL REFEREE
Who We Are
PickUp USA Fitness is a fast-growing basketball-focused fitness club. Our unique club provides our members with a weight-room and cardio area, luxury lounges, shooting machines, and several basketball courts.
We are passionate about delivering an unmatched basketball-focused fitness club experience to our members. To do this, we strive to maintain an immaculately clean club that operates one-of-a-kind basketball related services. One of these services is our Officiated PickUp Games. We run back-to-back-to-back organized 10-minute basketball games with 2 referees. It's a great atmosphere for our members and our staff!
Our referees work consistent shifts every week and are paid via direct deposit twice per month. Career advancement possibilities are abundant, and many of our refs quickly move up within the company.

DeliverA Better Way to Play!TM

We are Focused on Growth

Job_Description:

As scheduled on Saturdays beginning mid-March through mid-May

Supervision received: The Soccer Referee works under the supervision of the Soccer Commissioner and the Moab City Recreation Coordinator.

Attends referee clinic

Currently in our 4th season, our league has lofty goals and aspirations to be a premier league in the New England area.

Title: Youth Soccer Referee
Job_Description:
A soccer referee does more than wear a striped shirt and blow a whistle. A referee's role in the game includes work prior to the first kick and continues until after the game concludes. Understanding the critical nature of a referee's role in a soccer match helps you enjoy the game, whether you're watching the pre-K kids tumble over one another like puppies or observing a championship match.
Pre-Game Safety
In recreational leagues, a soccer referee conducts an audit of each team to ensure they're ready to play. He makes sure every player has the proper gear and often asks players to pound on their shinguards to prove they have them on. The referee also checks that jewelry is removed. Earrings, bracelets and necklaces aren't typically allowed in recreational leagues due to the potential for injury. The referee also confirms that each team is fielding a sufficient number of players to avoid forfeiting the match.
Game Safety
A referee plays an active role during the match itself. This role may be shared with assistant referees, but for smaller fields just one referee covers the entire pitch. This means a referee must be active, moving with the ball without actively interfering with play. This movement ensures that the referee is near the action if a player pushes or intentionally trips another player. Referees act as a safety net for all players, making sure the rules are followed and sportsmanlike play is enforced.
Time and Score Keeper
In recreational matches, without a large scoreboard to keep the crowd and players apprised of the time left and points scored, the referee keeps track of game time and the score. The referee typically uses a stopwatch to track quarters and halves, pausing the clock for timeouts. The referee may also use a counting device to track the score.
Post-Game
The referee typically must report injuries to the managing association after a game is complete. Particularly in youth leagues, where injury may be difficult to determine on-site, referees play a critical role in ensuring that the league follows up with the player. In professional leagues, this role is managed by the coaches and staff of the player's team. In addition, if any coach or player violated the rules of fair play as defined by the league, the referee creates a report and provides the league with a full description.

Position Details

Title: Mental Health Hearing Referee
Job_Description:
Position Description


POSITION TITLE: Mental Health Hearing Referee

SALARY: $8,089.18 - $10,325.45 Monthly
$97,070.16 - $123,905.40 Annually

OPENING DATE: 4/7/2023

CLOSING DATE: Continuous

EXAM NUMBER: R9618F

TYPE OF RECRUITMENT: Open Competitive Job Opportunity

ABOUT THE COURT
Los Angeles Superior Court is the largest unified trial court in the United States. Its 580 judges and commissioners work in one of the 40 facilities within the Court's 12 judicial districts and are supported by more than 4,500 full-time Court employees. The Court has an annual budget of more than $855 million. Located in Southern California, Los Angeles County is geographically one of the nation's largest counties, covering 4,084 square miles and, with over 10,400,000 residents, is also one of its most populous counties.


ABOUT THE POSITION
Mental Health Hearing Referees are responsible for conducting mental health facility-based hearings to determine probable cause for further involuntary detention and treatment of mentally disordered patients in psychiatric facilities and/or hearings to determine an individual's capacity to refuse psychotropic medications. The incumbents must exercise a broad knowledge of legal requirements regarding the mentally disordered and applicable provisions of the California Welfare and Institutions Code related to mental health.

For a detailed job description, please click here. Please note the requirements in the job description may vary from the requirements in the bulletin. Applicants must meet requirements stated in this bulletin.

TELEWORK OPPORTUNITIES
This position is eligible for partial telework following an initial training period.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
To qualify, you must meet one of the following options at the time of filing:

Option I: Five years of mental health experience, two years of which must have been performing full-time work with patients who are in a California in-patient mental health facility as one of the following:
California Licensed Psychologist
California Licensed Clinical Social Worker
California Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist
California Licensed Registered Nurse

Option II: A California Licensed Attorney* with two years of professional legal experience involving problems of the mentally ill and/or as a practicing attorney representing clients or conducting hearings related to conservatorship, Social Security benefits, habeas corpus proceedings, family law, or delinquency/dependency law, practicing law in California.

An active membership of the California State Bar in good standing is required for this qualification. Superior Court of California, County of Los Angeles Mental Health Hearing Referees are prohibited by Court policy from practicing law during their employment. This includes prohibition from receiving fees and appearing in any court on behalf of another person.

Option III: A licensed California medical doctor.

Note: Credit for experience is given based on a 40-hour workweek. Part-time experience is credited on a part-time ratio, i.e., working 20 hours per week for two months equals one month of experience. No additional credit is given for overtime.

REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION:
A Copy of your California Medical/Clinical License and/or Current California Bar Card showing active status must be submitted by the final filing application date.

Documentation may be submitted as follows:
As an attachment to your online application.
As an email attachment to Walter TuckerIV at WTuckerIV@lacourt.org - Please use the following subject line: “Mental Health Hearing Referee” - Education Verification (Your Name)”

Licenses; Certificates; Special Requirements:
A valid California Class C driver's license or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions.

EXAMINATION INFORMATION:

Qualifying evaluation of education, training and experience based upon submitted application materials and supplemental questionnaire at the time of filing.

APPLICATION and FILING INFORMATION:
Applications may only be filed online. To learn how to apply online, please access the Online Employment Application Guide. Los Angeles Superior Court reserves the right to verify all submitted documentation prior to appointment. The Court will only consider completed applications submitted, along with the required documents, and will reject incomplete applications. A resume will not substitute for a fully completed employment application. To facilitate the full and proper consideration of your work experience, clearly specify what professional experience meets the required job qualifications. When listing your work experience, please specify the beginning and end dates for each job you held and describe your experience for each position.

Please provide a current and accurate e-mail address for the Court to communicate with you about this job opportunity. Human Resources staff will notify all applicants of their application status via e-mail. We recommend that you add info@governmentjobs.com to your safe senders list to avoid the notification being filtered as spam mail.

Los Angeles Superior Court is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants with disabilities who require reasonable accommodations to participate in the recruitment process can contact the email address provided below. For additional employment information, please click here (Download PDF reader).

Questions regarding this posting may be e-mailed to WTuckerIV@lacourt.org

WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT:
We will notify you of the outcome after each step of the recruitment process has been completed. Applicants who successfully pass each (and all) examination part(s) will be placed on an eligible list good for one year. Other vacancies may be filled using this list.

Exam No.: R9618F
MENTAL HEALTH HEARING REFEREE
Applications may be submitted online at www.lacourt.org
OR via the HR computer kiosk at
Los Angeles Superior Court
Human Resources Administration
111 N. Hill Street, Room 203
Los Angeles, CA 90012

Exhibit and emphasize teamwork and sportsmanship.
Prepare reports and other written documents as needed.
Perform other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
Requires a strong knowledge Basketball, (past or present high school basketball certification preferred), including rules, scoring procedures, fouls and hand signals. Ability to move up and down the court with the flow of the game; could require some bending and lifting. Watch for and call all rule violations and be able to communicate reason for violation. Ability to resolve problems and conflicts at game site.
SCHEDULE:
Adult Leagues on Mon evenings. Season runs November through middle of February.

Title: Paintball Referee
Job_Description:
Splat City Referee Job Description
Are you looking for a fun and interactive job? Maybe a paintball referee position is perfect for you! Worried that paintballs hurt? Splat City specializes in low impact paintball! The newest paintball technology has come to Pensacola, FL to provide more fun for the whole family! Players and paintball referees now get the ultimate paintball experience with no pain! Splat City Paintball is currently accepting applications for both entry level paintball referees and supervisions positions.
Employees will be responsible for supplying customers with a safe and fun environment to experience paintball! Paintball referee members are to maintain the paintball facility, gear, and customer interactions. Staff members will conduct safety briefings, game play, staging area regulations and more. Splat City strives to make sure both players and spectators are always escorted. Employees will also get to enjoy the new style of play with low impact paintballs! These paint balls are smaller and lighter than traditional paintballs (.50 vs. .68). These paint balls are specifically engineered with both the player and paintball referee in mind to deliver less energy on impact. Experience fast paced paintball with little to no sting!
Paintball Job Description
The referee position may range from part time to full time with hours ranging from 5 to 40 hours a week.
Scheduled hours may depend available on workload, scheduled events, pending reservations and personal performance.
Paintball referee members are responsible for ensuring the customers have an excellent paintball experience
Referees have one of the most influential jobs at the paintball park because they will be interacting face to face with customers for the duration of the day.
Referees’ priorities include providing the best no pain paintball experience while maintaining a safe and fun atmosphere.
Maintaining Rental Equipment
Must have reliable transportation!
This is a part-time job for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. Weekends are a MUST, but we’d like for you to work one day during the week, preferably Friday to help get ready for the weekend.
Age 17+. Apply in person

Position: Refereeing youth between the ages of 3-14 in the sport of your choosing. Saturday hours between 9am-3pm and Sunday hours between 12pm and 6pm.

▪ Understand the rules: Knowing and implementing the rules is an easy yet essential part of being a great official.
▪ Culture cultivator : Keep everything positive! In order to change a negative behavior, you have to first set the example by staying friendly and positive at all times.

▪ Keep games on time: We promote convenience to our families and a prompt start and effective clock management are a big component of this.

Title: Ultimate Hoops Referee
Job_Description:
We love the game of basketball, and because we believe anyone can play, we hope everyone will. We are looking for talented people to inspire our members to keep playing the game. If you wake up every day fired-up to serve our members with your basketball talents, we want you on our squad. We offer a career path in sports, continued investment in our team members' education, provide industry-leading compensation, flexible scheduling, an incredible benefits package and a Life Time membership.
Position Summary
The Ultimate Hoops Referee assists in the execution of Ultimate Hoops Basketball League by officiating league games. They work closely with league coordinators and players to ensure a respectful and fun Ultimate Hoops experience.
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Officiates Ultimate Hoops basketball games fairly
Follows and enforces all Ultimate Hoops rules during games
Interacts with players in a respectful, cooperative manner
Works closely with League Coordinator to ensure member satisfaction
Actively promotes Ultimate Hoops and Life Time Fitness to members and non-members
Articulates extensive knowledge of Ultimate Hoops and Life Time Fitness programs, products, services, policies and procedures to prospective and current members
Position Requirements
High School Diploma or GED
Less than 1 year of experience operating scoreboards
General knowledge of basketball rules
Certified basketball official with local governing body
Pay
This position pays a class rate between $30.00 and $65.00, based on experience and qualifications, for all working time associated with teaching classes (including without limitation, all time spent in class as well as all pre- and post-class working time). The class rate is based on typical classes that range between 31 and 74 minutes in length. For classes 30 minutes or less, 0.70 times the class rate will be paid. For classes 75 minutes or more, 1.5 times the class rate will be paid.
Life Time is a place for everyone. As an organization, we are committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that respects and celebrates the unique contributions of each individual while ensuring we remain an equal opportunity employer that recruits, hires, trains and promotes based on merit and qualifications.

Job_Description:
Job Description
Click here to see full job description

Must be 14 or older to apply

SUMMARY: Under the direction of the Recreation Coordinator; officiates baseball, basketball, flag football, pickleball, lacrosse, softball, or soccer games for leagues and tournament play.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Official/Referee/Scorekeeper I: Prefer some officiating experience in baseball, basketball, flag football, pickleball, softball, soccer, or volleyball; certification helpful, but not required-position will require you to be trained and then pass a test before officiating. Must be 14 years of age or older to apply.

Knowledge of baseball, basketball, flag football, pickleball, lacrosse, softball, or soccer game rules and equipment usage; proper English usage. Great responsibility for the care, condition, and use of materials, equipment, tools, etc. Great responsibility in showing strong leadership skills while using rules to make officiating decisions which affect the activities of people. Occasional use of office equipment including telephone, computer, copy machine, fax machine; in addition to use of computerized scoreboard.
NOTE: Applications may only be submitted online at https://jobs.citysuitehr.com/sandycity. Sandy City does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, protected veteran’s status or other classes protected by applicable federal, state and local employment law. Sandy City is a drug-free workplace and an Equal Opportunity Employer. Must pass drug test before hire. If the position is a step position, it may be filled at a lower level.
Company Description
Sandy City is located in beautiful Salt Lake County, Utah. Our walkable and transit-oriented city center called "The Cairns" connects mountain adventure with an active urban lifestyle. With a bustling city arts and entertainment scene, world-class mountain skiing and summer recreation, a strong network of trails and outdoor public spaces, and unsurpassed shopping and dining, Sandy City is a destination location like no other!
With low property taxes, a low crime rate, great job availability, a highly-rated school system, and excellent entertainment and recreation options, Sandy City is a great place to live and work. If you think you are ready to be a part of our community, then we encourage you to continue with this job application!

Title: Volleyball Referee
Job_Description:
Referee
Richmond Volleyball Club is a large adult and youth volleyball nonprofit organization with approximately 2,500 members. RVC is dedicated to the sport and its members, and now that we have more and more players, we are looking for more referees!
If you are willing to earn extra money, and you like the sports atmosphere, this position will be a great fit!
Flexible schedule Sunday thru Friday, 6PM to 10PM or 11PM each night.
Even if you are new to volleyball, as long as you are curious and motivated, we'll help you to learn and understand.
We provide candidates an RVC's rules manual, allowing them to learn at their own pace all the rules and calls for volleyball. After an observation and evaluation process, the manager will determine which level the candidate can referee.
If the candidates are interested in learning faster, or willing to referee higher levels, they can intend our clinics. Clinics are held according to interest/need and dates are posted on the Club Calendar and various social media outlets.
Pay is between $16/hr to $20/hr.
For more information about us, please visit our website: www.rvc.net
The Richmond Volleyball Club is deeply committed to a community of excellence, equity, and diversity and welcomes applications from women, underrepresented minorities, persons with disabilities, sexual minority groups, and other candidates who will contribute to the diversification and enrichment of ideas and perspectives.

Title: REFEREE
Job_Description:
Want to give back to your community and impact a child's life? Become a referee for the YMCA! We are looking for referee's for our upcoming Flag Football and Basketball seasons. Working for the YMCA you not only will be financially compensated, but as a Part Time employee you will receive a FREE family membership to the YMCA along with a discount on all programs.
POSITION SUMMARY: The YMCA of Coastal Carolina is a dynamic and rapidly growing association that seeks to strengthen the community through youth development, healthy living and social responsibility. The Membership Representative is responsible for providing excellent service to all members, guests, and program participants. They will respond to member and guest needs, promote memberships and programs, and maintain the cleanliness and organization of the lobby area.
OUR CULTURE: Our mission and core values are brought to life by our culture. In the Y, we strive to live our cause of strengthening communities with purpose and intentionality every day. We are welcoming: we are open to all. We are a place where you can belong and become. We are genuine: we value you and embrace your individuality. We are hopeful: we believe in you and your potential to become a catalyst in the world. We are nurturing: we support you in your journey to develop your full potential. We are determined: above all else, we are on a relentless quest to make our community stronger beginning with you.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The YMCA Sports Official must have the competencies, skills and proven leadership ability to successfully carry out the YMCA mission, goals and vision for serving the community. Other important responsibilities include the following:
Officiate assigned YMCA sports events
Assist with pre and post-game setup and logistics
Assist with preparation and inspection of the game site
Maintain control in facilities being used at all times, monitor and respond to horseplay, and enforce all YMCA rules and policies
Keep current on all schedule changes
Provide positive member service, program promotion, and policy education to participants
Attend appropriate and required training classes offered by the YMCA of Coastal Carolina
Maintain safe program areas, including indoor and outdoor areas, YMCA and non-YMCA facilities, and equipment
Maintain a courteous, friendly attitude and be a positive role model
Promote the YMCA Story with all involved in the program
Must demonstrate courtesy and service to program participants and maintain a professional appearance
Follow YMCA policies and decision in a supportive manner. Follow accident reporting procedures and policies. Serve as a first responder to emergency situations
Follow systems, practices, and training related to risk management and safety of participants and staff
Other duties as assigned by supervisor
QUALIFICATIONS:
Must be 18 years of age
Minimum of 2 years of experience officiating sports programs. Must be certified in officiating a specific sport(s) or have equivalent experience in a professional coaching or teaching environment is preferred
Must understand the basic principles of sports programs such as basketball, soccer, football, volleyball, and/or others as assigned Must understand the basic concepts of a non-profit organization, as well as the structure of the YMCA as a partnership of volunteers and staff, and accept a commitment to the YMCA of Coastal Carolina
Demonstrate diplomatic interpersonal skills
Must be able to establish and maintain harmonious relationships by promoting caring, honesty, respect, and responsibility with staff, YMCA members, and program participants
Ability to relate to children and parents
Ability to intervene in conflict resolution
Certifications required within the first 30 days of hire: YMCA approved basic lifesaving skills such as CPR, First Aid, AED, and Emergency Oxygen
Complete all required Redwoods trainings by their completion deadlines
Child Abuse Prevention supports the YMCAs commitment to child abuse prevention by:
Reporting any items that may provide a health or safety hazard to staff, members or guests to your supervisor
Following all policies and procedures related to keeping children safe in our facilities and programs, including those related to the monitoring and supervision of children
Reporting any suspicious behavior and violation of policy and procedures to your supervisor
Completing all child abuse prevention training as required
YMCA COMPETENCIES (LEADER): Mission Advancement: Accepts and demonstrates the Ys values. Demonstrates a desire to serve others and fulfill community needs. Recruits volunteers and builds effective, supportive working relationships with them. Supports fund-raising. Collaboration: Works effectively with people of different backgrounds, abilities, opinions, and perceptions. Builds rapport and relates well to others. Seeks first to understand the other persons point of view, and remains calm in challenging situations. Listens for understanding and meaning; speaks and writes effectively. Takes initiative to assist in developing others.

Title: Scorekeeper, Waltham
Job_Description:
Scorekeeper - Basketball (Monday Evenings)
LEARN, GROW and THRIVE WITH A CAREER AT THE Y
Imagine going to work knowing that what you do each day positively affects the lives of the people in your community. Working at the Y, you’ll discover more than a job—you’ll enjoy a career with a future and the opportunity to make a lasting difference in the lives of those around you.

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Director of programming, the Adult Sports Scorekeeper is responsible for compiling and organizing adult league scores, and statistics. This position works directly with adult athletes ages 18+ years old. This position is directly responsible for the organization of team and individual statistics, along with the cleaning and sanitizing of team bench areas between contests.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Tally team total scores on YMCA provided scoreboard
Manage individual player statistics throughout each game including, but not limited to, points scored, and fouls against.
Clean and sanitize bench areas before, between, and after games in which the benches were used.
Inform athletes and officials of league specific rules, and future
Manage and track team win-loss records to help with official league standings.

YMCA LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES:
Relationships: Builds rapport and relates well to others
Inclusion: Works effectively with people of different backgrounds, abilities, opinions and perceptions.
Innovation: Embraces new approaches and discovers ideas to create a better member experience.
Quality Results: Strives to meet or exceed goals and deliver a high-value experience for members.
Self-Development: Pursues self-development that enhances job performance.

QUALIFICATIONS:
The candidate must be willing to work late nights, and weekend days.
Must have the ability to work within a fast-paced sports environment.
Candidate must possess a solution oriented perspective while maintaining a professional and friendly demeanor.
Candidate must have knowledge of the sport they are working with, and must have a strong understanding of the scoring processes, and statistics kept for each sport.
Candidate must be willing to help with cleaning and sanitizing processes to promote a healthy environment for all staff, players, and referees.

Title: Court Attorney -Referee
Company: The New York State Unified Court System
Job_Description:
Court Attorney-Referees act as special referees and research and analyze complex legal issues and questions raised in civil and criminal cases heard in trial courts or on appeal to certain County Courts and may be responsible for supervision of court attorneys and support staff who are located in one or more courts situated throughout a county, judicial district, or department. They serve in a confidential capacity and work with substantial independence from supervision in units located in the Court of Claims or special parts in the Supreme Court or in County, District, Family, and Surrogate`s Courts in counties entirely within cities or in counties that have populations exceeding 400,000.
ASSIGNMENT: This position will be assigned to the Law department of Surrogate's Court - Kings County. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to: conducting hearings to either hear and report or hear and determine; taking testimony and reporting findings of facts to judge; researching and analyzing complex legal questions and issues; and writing confidential memoranda and drafting opinions.
QUALIFICATIONS: Admission to the New York State Bar and Three (3) years of service in the Associate Court Attorney title; or Eight (8) years of relevant legal experience gained after admission to the New York State Bar.

Title: Personal Basketball Trainer
Job_Description:
Basketball Trainer
PickUp USA Fitness is currently hiring for a full-time basketball trainer that will perform various duties at our fast-growing fitness club.
Who We Are
PickUp USA Fitness is a fast-growing basketball-focused fitness club. Our unique club provides our members with a full weight-room and cardio area, luxury lounges, shooting machines, and several basketball courts.
We are passionate about delivering an unmatched basketball-focused fitness club experience to our members. To do this, we strive to maintain an immaculately clean club that operates one-of-a-kind basketball related services. One of these services is our Officiated PickUp Games. We run back-to-back-to-back organized 10-minute basketball games with 2 referees daily. In addition, we run daily group training sessions and offer private training packages to members looking to take their game to the next level! The latter will be the Trainer’s primary focus.
Our Core Mission
Deliver A Better Way to Play!TM
Our Core Values
We are Passionate about our Brand
We are Focused on Growth
We Do What We Say
We Respect Each Individual
Job Summary
Make a difference every day while building an exciting career in basketball & fitness. You will complete a comprehensive training program that, upon successful completion, will set the foundation of success for you as our Basketball/Fitness Trainer.
You will assist the management team in nurturing a fun, friendly, and clean environment. More specifically, you will be the heart and soul of our one-of-a-kind Group Workout and Private Training Services. Functions that are integral to our Core Mission of delivering A Better Way to Play!TM
As a Basketball Trainer at PickUp USA Fitness you will work one-on-one and in small groups with members to help them achieve their basketball/fitness objectives. Be the spark that inspires someone to keep training, to try harder, and be the best they can possible be. We will help you advance your career through our development program and provide you access to our countless list of prospective clients.
Job Responsibilities
The Trainer’s primary responsibilities include the following:
Conduct a fun and engaging group basketball workout that challenges members to reach their basketball/fitness goals
Conduct goal-oriented one-on-one private training sessions focused on member objectives
Prospect relentlessly to grow the pipeline of potential clients
Assist GMs in meeting operational goals and PickUp USA Fitness Brand Standards
Assist GMs in meeting financial goals by selling Private Training and membership packages
Estimated % Time Spent
20 % - Leading Group Basketball Classes
65 % - Conducting One-on-One Basketball/Fitness Training
15 % - Booking & Conducting Basketball/Fitness Skills Assessments
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Expertise in Basketball/Fitness
Knowledge of safe exercise techniques and principles
Ability to effectively demonstrate all skills being taught
Outgoing, energetic, and thrives in performing in front of an audience
Experience in running or being part of group workouts
Eager learner able to follow directions
Punctual and able to project a professional image through dress, behavior, and attitude
Ability to deal with a diverse member base
Ability to deal with all age groups
Experience in customer-facing position with demonstrated customer-service skills
Experience in prospecting and sales with demonstrated strong communication skills
Minimum Educational Level
High School Diploma
Minimum Work Experience and Qualifications
Expertise in basketball training
Expertise in fitness training
Physical Demands/Environmental Conditions
Ability to work in fitness club; move about club floors and rooms; review, revise, create club paperwork; communicate with employees, members, prospects, club owner, & vendors
Required to demonstrate or explain proper physical fitness/basketball activities, techniques and procedures
Ability to communicate telephonically with members and prospects
Ability to access and operate Company computer systems including preparing documents, entering data into computer systems, reading reports from a computer data base or email system
While performing the duties of this job, regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts
The noise level in the environment is occasionally loud
Ability to work a varied schedule to support the needs of the business, including frequent extended workdays, and weekends and holidays may be required
Required/Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrable expertise in basketball is required
Sales experience is preferred
Fitness industry experience is preferred
Operations management experience is preferred
Work Schedule
Assigned Group Workouts
Additional Flex Hours based on Private Training Schedule
Job Type
Full-time
Compensation
This position offers base pay PLUS commissions
Increased base pay for PT sessions executed
Complimentary gym membership
Club Advantages for Trainer
Clean and fully equipped training facility that houses the following amenities
Multiple courts
Functional training area
Cardio equipment
Machine & free weights
Vertimax
Dr. Dish Shooting Gun
Towel Service
Air Conditioning/Heating
Hundreds of potential clients available for prospecting
Action Items to Apply
If you are interested in joining our team and taking your career to the next level, please submit your Resume with a Cover letter!
In your Cover Letter, please detail why you believe you are qualified to be a PickUp USA Fitness Personal/Group Trainer. In your Resume, please highlight past sales, and most importantly, basketball/fitness-related experiences that showcase your qualifications to help lead our team and deliver world class basketball-focused fitness services to our members.
For more details about us, please visit our website: www.pickupusafitness.com
Disclaimer
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by incumbents assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the responsibilities, duties and skills required. The incumbent may be expected to perform other duties as assigned. This job may be reviewed as duties and responsibilities change with business necessity.
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $15.00 - $35.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Ability to commute/relocate:
Houston, TX 77070: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Shift availability:
Night Shift (Preferred)
Day Shift (Preferred)

Title: Scorekeeper, Waltham
Job_Description:
Scorekeeper - Basketball (Monday Evenings)
LEARN, GROW and THRIVE WITH A CAREER AT THE Y
Imagine going to work knowing that what you do each day positively affects the lives of the people in your community. Working at the Y, you’ll discover more than a job—you’ll enjoy a career with a future and the opportunity to make a lasting difference in the lives of those around you.

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Director of programming, the Adult Sports Scorekeeper is responsible for compiling and organizing adult league scores, and statistics. This position works directly with adult athletes ages 18+ years old. This position is directly responsible for the organization of team and individual statistics, along with the cleaning and sanitizing of team bench areas between contests.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Tally team total scores on YMCA provided scoreboard
Manage individual player statistics throughout each game including, but not limited to, points scored, and fouls against.
Clean and sanitize bench areas before, between, and after games in which the benches were used.
Inform athletes and officials of league specific rules, and future
Manage and track team win-loss records to help with official league standings.

YMCA LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES:
Relationships: Builds rapport and relates well to others
Inclusion: Works effectively with people of different backgrounds, abilities, opinions and perceptions.
Innovation: Embraces new approaches and discovers ideas to create a better member experience.
Quality Results: Strives to meet or exceed goals and deliver a high-value experience for members.
Self-Development: Pursues self-development that enhances job performance.

QUALIFICATIONS:
The candidate must be willing to work late nights, and weekend days.
Must have the ability to work within a fast-paced sports environment.
Candidate must possess a solution oriented perspective while maintaining a professional and friendly demeanor.
Candidate must have knowledge of the sport they are working with, and must have a strong understanding of the scoring processes, and statistics kept for each sport.
Candidate must be willing to help with cleaning and sanitizing processes to promote a healthy environment for all staff, players, and referees.

WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Title: Sports League Referee
Job_Description:
Overwhelmingly, people who decide they want to be a part of the Y in Central Maryland tell us they do so because it reflects their values and a conscious decision, they’ve made about how they choose to live their lives. The happiest and most fulfilled Y associates are those who are motivated to help others and who want to be a part of something larger than themselves. If this speaks to your heart, then we invite you to join our team. Be a part of a charitable, mission-driven organization that works for individual and community well-being for all, for a better us.

How this role contributes to the Y’s mission:
As a Y Program Associate, you’ll be an important part of amission-driven, charitable organization that helps children, adults, families, and communities achieve more in all aspects of life. The Y Program Associate provides excellent member services to youth in member paid programs such as, but not limited to rock wall, sports, fun days and birthday parties. As a Y Program Associate, you’ll contribute to the Y and to the broader community we serve by creating experiences that help people feel a greater sense of health and well-being, purpose, acceptance and belonging.

This work is right for you if you have:
An enthusiastic love for children of all ages, patience, good judgment and a good spirit
Prior experience with youth or youth programming
The ability to clearly communicate and effectively listen to children, parents/guardians, members, and other Y associates
The ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and weekends
The Y in Central Maryland provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. Moreover, the Y is firmly committed to celebrating and achieving diversity and inclusion in all we do. We strive to be an anti-racist organization and expect all associates to treat others with respect, kindness and dignity, at all times. Thank you for considering working for the Y in Central Maryland. If being a part of our cause feels right for you, we hope you will join us.
