Title: Sports Performance Coach
Job_Description:
Become a Performance Coach with RPM Athlete Performance
Position Summary
You are a self-starter with a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit. You love the feeling you get when you see your clients improve in every way possible, both in competition and in life!
This is an opportunity to immerse yourself in a game-changing program, working with driven student-athletes and adults within the performance and wellness industry. Our coaches work directly with individuals, small groups and teams to help them achieve sustained peak performance through our holistic approach, Integrated Performance Training. Coaches will learn, contribute to, and deliver programs both virtually and in person.
Our Mission: We help individuals deliver exceptional performances and live amazing lives.
If this sounds like something you want to do every day for yourself and for others, we would love to meet you and explore this opportunity together.
Duties & Responsibilities
Properly adhering to company policies, procedures and executing operations
Effectively distribute attention to all individuals in the training block (max. 8 athletes) to maximize safety and quality of movement in athletes.
Communicate with athletes to understand their goals, assess current position, and apply/modify program to address athlete’s specific needs
Connect with director of athlete development regarding athlete programming and Team RPM app program design
Accurately document relevant athlete information
Deliver programming to athletes of varying skill, age, and strength levels during group training blocks
Develop thorough understanding of primary functions on Team RPM app and educate athletes to execute app engagement effectively
Continuously learn a unique approach to wellness and performance training
Communicate and align with a diverse team of professionals to achieve common goals for our athletes
Oversee the safety and cleanliness of the gym
Weekly professional development on site with team Mondays 12:00pm-1:00pm
Monthly professional review with Director of Athlete Development
Requirements
CPT, Certified Personal Trainer (NASM or NSCA OR CSCS institutions preferred)
Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication skills
Excellent time management
Hard working and highly motivated to learn and contribute to a continuously evolving business
Details
Paid professional development training.
BONUS program for membership and training sales.
Group training sessions vary weekly, starting 5-10+ hours a week.
Opportunities to advance rapidly in this dynamic environment with 1:1 clients for the right individual. You get what you put in AND we offer a ton of support to help you grow your own clientele within the RPM community.
Opportunity to advance to full time, develop into leadership role with experience and demonstrated proficiency.
Located in Newton, MA
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Pay: $30.00 - $100.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Professional development assistance
Schedule:
4 hour shift
8 hour shift
After school
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability
Supplemental pay types:
Bonus pay
Commission pay
Ability to commute/relocate:
Newton, MA 02459: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
Training: 2 years (Preferred)
License/Certification:
Certified Personal Trainer (Required)
Work Location: One location

Title: Basketball Coach
Job_Description:
About Togetherhood
Togetherhood is a marketplace for independent enrichment providers. We are a trusted source of consistently-outstanding enrichment experiences, across any topic, whether it be arts & crafts, skateboarding, breakdancing, performing arts with Broadway performers, STEM through the lens of Harry Potter or soccer with a former college athlete. We are a safe, secure community where children can experience the world around them, learn and, most importantly, have fun with their friends in programs led by other members of the community. Our mission is to enable consistently outstanding enrichment so that every one (regardless of their circumstances) has the opportunity to become who they aspire to be. We are focused on finding passionate, talented enrichment providers and giving them the autonomy and support they need to create engaging and magical experiences for children.

What You'll Do
You will be matched with opportunities to coach basketball at elementary school students at schools, buildings and communities across New York City. These teaching opportunities will be for terms that could last anywhere from 6 weeks to 18 weeks. In this role, you'll have the following responsibilities:

Consistently arrive on location on time to get set up to teach your class
Create lessons and practices that blend skill-building and gameplay
Pick up the children from their teachers and be responsible for them throughout the class
Manage the group of students, ensuring that they all behave in a safe and respectful manner
Handle pick up of the students by their parents. Ensure that children are only released to people approved to pick the child up.
Help children develop a deep love for the beautiful game
Who You Are
Fun, enthusiastic, experienced basketball coach, with deep experience teaching school age children.
Able to create positive class community and build relationships with students
Experience leading your own classes
Has excitement, joy and passion for teaching kids and personal development/learning
Cooperative, supportive, flexible
Has a strong work ethic and do whatever it takes mind set
Clean background check and at least three references

Title: Part Time Youth Sports Coach
Job_Description:
Youth Sports Coaches Wanted
5 Star Sports Academy, Inc. has been in, and around, Lake County developing the athletic skills of the surrounding children for over 10 years. We are looking for someone who can pass forward their own sports knowledge/expertise, and teach groups of kids, predominantly ranging from 3-10 years old. We work inside a variety of park districts, but we will discuss your own travel limits, and do our best to schedule you in the locations nearest to you. This is a part time position to begin, however, if you excel, the position could become full time, with additional work that you can do from home. This job is also great for seasonal work while high school and college semesters are on summer break.
We are looking for high energy, reliable people who have a background in sports, and some experience working with kids is preferred, but not absolutely necessary. A centerpiece of success for this position is being outgoing, using an amplified tone, and refraining from any quiet and soft speech while coaching. This job is fun, and you can make it rewarding if you're willing to overachieve.
Please apply if you can meet the following criteria:
1. Open availability, evenings 4PM-8PM on weekdays, and early mornings to mid-afternoon on weekends
2. Have a competitive sports background.
3. Reliable and ready to work remotely
4. Good communication skills with young kids
5. Can work in these park districts: Barrington, West Dundee, Long Grove
Job Type: Part-time
Pay: $16.00 - $22.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability
Supplemental pay types:
Bonus pay
Tips
Work Location: One location

Title: Summer Camp Sports Coach
Location: 18070 Collins Ave, Sunny Isles Beach, FL 33160
Job_Description:
Description
Summer Camp begins 6/12/2023 and ends 8/11/2023.

Responsible for those programs assigned to them as well as supervising a group of approximately 10 children. Reports to the Athletic Program Coordinator.

Summer Camp activities at the City of Sunny Isles Beach may include, but are not limited to, athletic and sports-related events, arts and crafts, music, life skills and field trips.

Position incumbent supports City sponsored programs; provides supervision with related activities, and must maintain effective working relationships with teammates, program participants, children and/or parents, as necessary.
Illustrative Examples of Essential Duties
Prepare lesson planning for each day of the program.
Prepare the program area for the different activities, ensuring safety and security.
Instruct (or assist) children in the various activities providing guidance and coaching as necessary.
Track the campers' attendance.
Administer first aid, if necessary.
Maintain adequate inventory of program or recreational activity supplies.
Ensure supervisor is updated orally, or in writing, on all activities and is kept informed of any related issues.
If required, perform facility maintenance, i.e. garbage disposal or cleaning up.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Ability to work well with children.
Ability to be friendly and courteous at all times when working with the children and staff.
Ability to be creative with activities for the children.
Ability to delegate tasks to assistants.
Ability to take direction from supervisory staff.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to establish effective working relationship with children, adults and coworkers.
Ability to lead activities, drills, games and apply rules of various sports i.e. soccer, volleyball, baseball, basketball, cheerleading etc.
Ability to work prolong hours outdoors.
Ability to stand or be physically active for prolong hours.
Minimum Requirements


Education and Experience:
High School diploma required. Associate's or Bachelor's degree in a related field such as education, recreation or physical education preferred.
Minimum of one year of related experience working with children preferably in a summer camp environment; or any acceptable combination of education and experience.


License or Certification:
CPR and First Aid certification is required and must be obtained before 6/1/2023 and remain valid through 8/11/2023.
Fingerprints and VECHS background check required.
Florida Driver's License may be required.
40-hour Child Care Certificate preferred.

Additional Information:
It is the responsibility of the incumbent to maintain their licenses and/or certifications as a job requirement.
Must be available to work at least 90% of the camp duration (6/12/2023 - 8/11/2023).
Must also attend mandatory staff meeting orientation on 5/22/2023 - 5/26/2023, parent orientation on 6/1/2023, and may be required to assist a week prior to start of camp, and week after camp ends. Dates subject to change.

No city paid benefits with the exception of those required by law.

Title: Basketball Coach
Job_Description:
Job Description
Job Title: Basketball Coach
FLSA Status: Exempt
EEO Category: Professionals
Position Summary: Engage, inspire and transform our student athletes through training, development, coaching, and mentoring both on and off the court.
Responsibilities
Cultivate a Basketball program that is rooted in integrity, growth, learning, passion and teamwork
Foster a program that inspires greatness through actions, words, behavior, and accountability.
Create a communitive environment encouraging parents, educators and admin to work together for the development of our student-athletes.
Establish training techniques with a track record of success in technical skills and character development

Proven experience coaching and/or playing basketball in a manner that is consistent with our values
Strong commitment to Student Athletes
General Microsoft office computer skills with strong communication skills
Experience working with basic video technology such as editing, burning, and filming

Bilingual
Experience with college planning and placement process
Desire to work collaboratively with colleagues
Valid driver’s license with ability to drive for tournaments, games, travel

Title: Assistant Football Coach
Job_Description:
ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY ON THE EMORY & HENRY COLLEGE WEBSITE
https://www.ehc.edu/human-resources/employment-opportunities/
About this position
The Assistant Coach, Football supports the Head Coach, Football. In that support role, the Assistant Coach is responsible for helping to operate a program for student-athletes, with differing abilities and skills, and serves as a role model to student athletes.
The successful candidate must be able to:
implement and communicate offensive or defensive schemes,
oversee a position group
evaluate personnel,
assist the Head Coach, Football in all aspects of game and practice preparation,
mentor and monitor student-athletes' academic progress,
follow all rules and guidelines set forth by the NCAA, SAC and Emory & Henry College.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Analyze performance and instruct athletes in skills, techniques and strategies in preparation for competition and during contests.
Assist the head coach, as directed, in the coordination of general administrative duties (including budgeting, game scheduling, travel plans, meeting requests for information, and business procedures).
Communicate with the athletic trainer, Director of Athletics Communication, the Sports Information Director, Associate Director of Athletics, and department administrators as directed by the head coach.
As directed by the head coach, plan, organize, implement, and evaluate recruiting and scouting activities.
Assist, as directed by the head coach, the Associate Director of Athletics in matters for which he/she is responsible including ordering and inventorying of equipment, and maintenance and use of facilities for contests and practices.
Adhere to and follow all rules and guidelines of Emory & Henry College, Old Dominion Athletic Conference and the NCAA.
Secondary Duties
Other duties as assigned.
Game day management duties.
About our ideal candidate
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree required.
Previous coaching experience required.
College playing experience is preferred.
Skills, Characteristics Required for Position:
Ability to coach, teach and train student-athletes in skills and strategies specific to their sport
Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the stages of student development and the importance of holistic education.
Ability to establish appropriate and effective mentoring relationships with student-athletes.
Ability to be a supportive team player within the Department of Athletics and Emory & Henry College.
Ability to communicate effectively and professionally.
A working knowledge of recruiting and compliance software.
Demonstrated commitment to continued learning/professional development (i.e., attend conferences, clinics, workshops).
About us
Located in the Highlands of Virginia, Emory & Henry College has devoted itself since 1836 to the belief that education can have a transformative effect on an individual, a place and ultimately the wider world.
Inspired by the motto “Increase in Excellence,” the first faculty challenged students to grow and develop intellectually, spiritually and physically.
Today, our mission continues to focus on students as they follow a path of intellectualand spiritualgrowth on their way to successful futures. That mission, in turn, is extended to others through a broad program of active engagement and community service.
You will discover that Emory & Henry is a place of promise made up of warm-hearted, caring people who care about your fulfillment. This is a community that embraces people from all walks of life as they work together to improve the individual and the world. We are people with a missionand a long historydevoted to transforming lives and increasing excellence.
Emory & Henry views diversity, equity, and inclusionas foundational to our institution, and strives to continually “increase in excellence” in this endeavor. In doing so, we recognize the forced removal and stolen labor at the heart of the very founding (and naming) of our College. We also acknowledge the negative impact of power imbalances, discrimination, and exclusion on generations of marginalized groups dating back to the inception of Emory & Henry College. We also recognize that, while this statement is important, it is an insufficient approach to the liberation of impacted peoples.
It is the policy of Emory & Henry College to provide equal employment, educational and social opportunities for all persons, without regard to race (or traits historically associated with race including hair texture, hair type, and protective hairstyles such as braids, locks, and twists), color, religion, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), national origin, gender identity or expression, age, veteran status, disability, political affiliation, sexual orientation or genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
NOTE: As a member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA), our employees will be knowledgeable about and abide by all NCAA rules and regulations to ensure compliance with departmental, university, conference and NCAA policies and regulations.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off
Relocation assistance
Retirement plan
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance
Work Location: In person

Health insurance

Title: Athletic Coach
Location: 1376 E Cottonwood Ln, Casa Grande, AZ 85122
Job_Description:
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Holds organizational meetings for team prospects and encourages potential athletes to participate in the sport.
Assesses players skills and assigns team positions.
Develops a regular practice schedule and organizes practice time to provide both individual and team development.
Works with the athletics director in scheduling facilities for practices and competition.
Assigns duties to assistant coaches as necessary.
Coaches and instructs players, individually or in groups, regarding the rules, regulations, equipment, and techniques of the sport.
Observes players, during competition and practice to determine the needs for individual or team improvement.
Determines game strategy based on the teams capabilities.
Establishes and maintains standards of behavior and provides proper supervision of athletes at all times.
Monitors the academic performance of team members to ensure that eligibility requirements are met; and encourages student athletes to maintain a high academic standard.
Follows established procedures in the event of an athletes injury.
Conferences with parents/guardians, as necessary, regarding the athletic performance of their student.
Models positive behavior and maintains appropriate conduct towards players, officials, and spectators.
Acts as a team representative and promotes the sport by communicating with the booster clubs, service clubs, and other organizations.
Follows established procedures for the proper care, maintenance, requisitioning of equipment, supplies, and uniforms.
Works with the athletic director to develop a policy for awards and submits a list of award winners at the end of the season.
Participates in special activities to include parents night, banquets, award nights, and pep assemblies.
Maintains eligibility forms, emergency data cards, insurance records, equipment inventory, and other related records.
Potentially drive athletes using district transportation to and from off campus games.
Models non discriminatory practices in all activities.
Other duties as assigned by supervisor.
Requirements:
Bachelors degree
Prior coaching experience preferred
Must be at least 21 years of age.

Title: Toddler Sports Coach
Job_Description:
Do you love sports? Are you a lover of children? Do you have extra hours to spare, mornings (9am-11am) or mid afternoons (2pm-4pm)? If yes to all of these then Shots Sports can be for you.
Shots Sports LLC is looking for a person who is charismatic, energetic and determined to make a positive difference in our young Learners lives and in our Coaching staff. Our Coaching positions consist of teaching exciting sports to Learners from 3 years of age up to age 8. Coaches travel to different Daycare Facilities, Schools and Camps throughout Dallas City and mostly North Dallas Suburbs (Allen, Frisco, Carrollton, Coppell, Valley Ranch) teaching 30 minute classes of Soccer, Basketball etc. Coaches must have a true love for working with kids and teaching movement and sports. Shots Sports is about giving young Learners confidence to be their best self! We jumpstart young Learners mental, physical and social abilities through Physical Fitness, education and sports young Learners love.
Coaches with us must be dedicated individuals who want to grow and expand with a commitment to children at our schools throughout the DFW area.
Requirements:
● Must be 18 years of age
● Must have a valid drivers’ license, have your own reliable vehicle (travel involved)
● Must be able to pass a state and federal background check at any moment. (This includes DUI, DWI and all violations of the law. You will be working with children)
● Must be willing to maintain and cultivate positive personal and professional relationships
● Must be able to carry 50lbs
● Ready to start August 2022
● Must be willing to travel to destinations in the North Dallas area i.e. Frisco, Coppell,
Allen, Frisco, Prosper, Carrollton etc..
● Available 5 days a week for mornings 8:00 am until 11:30 am and/or afternoons from 2:30pm until 5:00pm or both (negotiable)
● 1 year of coaching experience and/or teaching children (preferred)
Perks:
● Flexible schedule
● Not stuck to a desk
● Be your own boss
● Always potential to grow in company and workload

The School District of Palm Beach County is a drug and alcohol-free workplace. All employment categories are subject to the completion of drug testing pursuant to School Board Policy 3.96 or 3.961. Any applicant who tests positive for a drug as defined in the policies will not be hired. In addition, only certain employment categories are subject to the completion of a pre-employment medical examination by, and the receipt of, a medical clearance from professionals selected by the School Board. The medical examination may consist of a physical examination and/or testing for potentially impairing, disabling, communicable and terminal diseases or conditions including, but not limited to, tuberculosis and other pulmonary diseases, carcinoma, acquired immune deficiency syndrome, diabetes, hypertension, anemia, cardiovascular diseases, muscular skeletal diseases or disorders, hearing and visual impairments, mental or nervous disorders, alcoholism, and drug abuse.

Title: Youth Sports Coach - PART TIME
Job_Description:
STATEMENT OF THE JOB:

Youth Sports Coaches are key members of the Health & Wellness team and will report to the Senior Director of Health & Wellness. The primary
responsibilities include hands-on-coaching, lesson planning, and role modeling good sportsmanship for athletes aged 2-13 years old. Coaching
opportunities in the following sports; Tennis, Soccer, Basketball, Volleyball, Lacrosse, and Baseball/Tee-Ball. Youth Sports Coaches ensure
that fair play and the philosophy of the Youth Sports Programs is maintained. She/he is expected to assist in assessing a player's skills and abilities to help
create a balanced playing field. Create and implement lesson plans for practices. Maintain supervision and care of each athlete under the care of
the Youth Sports program. Organizing and maintaining sports equipment. Directly responsible for communicating team practices and games to team
members. Represent Commonpoint Queens in a positive light at all times.

SKILLS AND REQUIRED COMPETENCIES
Manage time well
Multitasking
Show initiative and be able to prioritize
Sports background
Be responsible and trustworthy
Previous experience coaching children
Teach life skills
Develop character
Communicate effectively with administration, parents, players and referees
Manage cleanliness of playing space
Performs any other related duties as assigned by League Coordinator
Assisting in equipment set-up and breakdown
Ability to be flexible and to adjust work schedule to reflect varying accounting deadlines
Effective verbal, listening and written communication skills
Effective organizational, stress and time management skills
Ability to work with a diverse group of people
Proactive work ethic and ability to perform with minimal supervision
Potential Locations:
Samuel Field Center 58-20 Little Neck Parkway Little Neck, NY 11362
Central Queens Center 67-09 108th St. Forest Hills, NY 11375
Bay Terrace Athletic Complex 212-00 23rd Ave Bayside, NY 11360
Potential Dates and Times:
Monday through Thursday 3-6pm
Saturday and Sundays 9-12pm or 3-6pm
Salary Range:
$20-25/hour based on experience

Commonpoint Queens (formerly known as the Central Queens Y) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit community center serving over 10,000 persons of diverse backgrounds in Queens County. Commonpoint provides a continuum of social, recreational, and educational services for children, families, and adults. For over two generations, Commonpoint Queens, located in Forest Hills, Queens, has been a special place for thousands of families, older adults, children, and individuals who participate in its parenting, preschool, after school, cultural arts, camping, health and fitness, social services, and senior programming
